How does Artblix decide the price of the products and the shipping?
Artblix does not participate in the pricing process. Our belief is that each artist or artisan has to name their own price and we respect their decisions. A 4% commission will be added to the price decided by the artist. The shipping is determined by the local post office and is based on international rules and tariffs.
In which way you differ from Etsy.com?
The main distinction is that Artblix has a strong offline component. The majority of local artists & artisans in Guatemala and the world still don’t have access to the global online market. At Artblix we know that economical exclusion comes as a result of lack of opportunity. To sell on Etsy.com you have to speak English, you have to be tech savvy and you have to have a bank account. Artblix gives the opportunity to the less tech-savvy artisans from remote areas of the world to be a part of global economy, even if they don’t have bank account and can’t speak English. This ensures customers that they will find artworks that they were not able to find before, and that each of these artworks will have an authentic cultural background.
What if I have more questions? 
We would love to hear from you. If you have questions related to the perks or a donation please feel free to email us at contact@artblix.com. If you just have a general comment on the campaign please feel free to express yourself on our Indiegogo comment page.

story:
Our Story

Tableau D'Hote Theatre is an award-winning independant English theatre company in Montreal founded by Mike Payette and Mathieu Perron in 2005. Since its founding, the company has produced 19 shows and worked with over 100 artists from across the city. Our mandate is to promote Canadian work that has never been presented in Montreal. The company is entirely self-financed and could not and will not survive without the generous support of individuals like you.


The Impact

Your donation will help ensure that the company survives to see another year. It will directly lend to our ability to continue creating groundbreaking Canadian theatre and provide artistic and employment opportunities for Canadian artists.


What We Need & What You Get

Our productions involve over twenty artists -- from designers to actors, technicians to publicists, producing theatre is expensive, albeit a rewarding investment, and we believe in paying people for the work they do.   We aim to keep our ticket prices affordable and accessible to all, and consequently, it becomes difficult to stay out of the red.  The majority of production costs are covered directly out of pocket by Mat & Mike.  And now, more than ever, we need your help.


We welcome you to check out our website, www.tableaudhotetheatre.ca, and see for yourself what we do, and why we need your support.

story:
Hi everyone.  I am trying to start my own photography business.  I really have a passion for photography.  I have not had a lesson in my life so what you see is all self taught.  I think that understanding the technical side of the art side is something that is a definite so I am also wanting to take a class that will teach me why this does that.  Also, it will just help me be a better photographer.  I am running this campaign because I want to be successful in this field.  In the mean time, I take headshots to help save for the things I need for my business.  My love for photography first started with my first born. I always had the camera in my hand.  Even after my third one, the love for it never stopped.  It was when my second child was born that I started venturing out to other avenues of photography.  My eldest child is a wonderful artist.  She can draw anything you put in front of her.  The name Drawn 2 You Photography came about by combining what she loved to do and what I loved to do.  I must say that over the years I have many collections that I cannot wait to share with others and that photography is still exciting to me. My camera goes everywhere with me because I never know when I am going to see something that will spark more creativity from me.  

Presently, my camera lens is on the outs  and so is the computer that I use to help create art from my photos.  I want to be able to provide better quality photos and art.  By having this equipment that is necessary to have a successful photography business, I will be able to secure bigger jobs and be competitive in charging professional rates.
 
Without this equipment, my business will not be competitive with others in my area and will not produce the quality needed to remain in the photography business.  Go to my website, http://drawn2you.zenfolio.com, check out my Before and After 5 Series, the Perspective and Focus Series.....at the moment I am highlighting my headshots category.  I have so many more ideas bursting at the seams I can't wait to share them.  I can only do this with your help and support.  
 

The approximate amount needed to fund this campaign will be $8,000.  The funds will help secure a new lens that is needed, a mac computer, printing and mounting of pictures onto canvas, framing, rental of gallery/booth, marketing and advertising.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with others by helping get the word out and providing the link to this site.  Any donation amount is more than appreciated. I know it automatically linked to $75 but you can scroll the bar and make a smaller contribution or a larger one.  Thank you so much!

story:
About Me

     Hi, my name is Brittany! I'm 20 years old and I've wanted to be an artist for as long as I can remember. Due to lack of support and fears of job insecurity, I have been afraid to pursue my dream until recently. Over the last few months, I have bought several instructional books and have been attempting to teach myself how to draw from square one. However, I have found myself having difficulty grasping the concepts on my own and I have realized that to make anymore progress, I need one-on-one instruction with another person.

The Purpose of My Campaign

     Currently, I work part-time in a very small town, and without any college education, my employment opportunites are extremely limited. Why not go to college to study art? Well, I'm in a situation where I do not qualify for financial assistance from the government and I do not want to take out student loans at the moment. The parent I live with refuses to help me pay for a college education because they do not support it, believing that it's a waste of time and money.

     For a long time, I have known about Schoolism, a website founded by Bobby Chiu, a well-known artist in the entertainment industry. Schoolism offers online art courses where professional human instructors provide personalized feedback to students as an alternative option to traditional college art courses. In September, Schoolism is offering a course covering the Fundamentals of Drawing.

Where the Money's Going

     The Drawing Fundamentals course with personalized feedback costs $498 for six weeks of instruction. Between helping my parent with bills and buying food for myself on minimum wage, I am just unable to save the money required in such a short amount of time.

     I know taking this course will lay the foundation for achieving my dream of being a successful artist. I have the desire and motivation required to accomplish my goal, but without the proper ground work or funds beneath me, I am stuck. If I'm able to take part in this course, I will have accomplished the hardest part of the journey, which is learning the fundamentals.

     With your help, I can use the knowledge I gain from successfully completing the fundamentals course to open the door for commissions that could possibly fund further education at a traditional college. If you could help me raise at least half of the $500 goal, I may be able to make up the difference myself.

     If this campaign happens to exceed the goal of $500, all extra money will be given to the Child's Play Charity, a charity that donates books, toys, and video games to children in hospitals.

The Perks

     You may notice that my perks stop at a relatively low number. The reason for this is, I have not yet learned enough to offer any decent artwork as compensation for your generosity. I also want to emphasize the fact that if only 25 people donated $20, I would be able to reach my goal. $20 can be too much for some to spare, so there's also the option of smaller donation amounts, ranging from $1 to $15.

     The postcard included for the $10, $15 & $20 amounts will feature a piece of abstract art that I created with my Bamboo Splash tablet.

     I have also created a Blogspot for the purpose of this campaign. If this actually gets any attention, I will record the names of everyone who donates to show my eternal appreciation.

Can't Donate?

No problem! You can still help me by spreading the word about my campaign on various social-networking sites. I would greatly appreciate any and all help towards taking the first step in achieving my dream. (:

story:
Fine Art Photography is Chris' passion. Styling, expression and story-telling is Sabrina's gift to the art world. Together they have so much to say through their collaborative art.

They are both so surprised and honored to have one of their collaborative pieces selected as 1 of only 12 works to be presented at the Magdalena Exhibition in conjunction with PhotoNola this year on December 12th in New Orleans. The theme of the exhibition is The Divine Feminine and a portion of sales at the event will be matched and donated to The Alliance for International Women's Rights.

It is such a privilege and honor to have been selected and it would mean so much for them to have the opportunity to attend in person.

Please help Chris and Sabrina get to Magdalena!

story:
[Consciousness will Triumph when we come together! Be the Pioneering Co-Creators of The Movement.] 

Divine Beings, the campaign is over but should you wish to contribute and be the Pioneering Co-creator, our Paypal- 108@signdc.org  

Pioneer Membership open till July 31st. Perks remain the same as below. Pioneer Members of this debut campaign  in the long haul of The Declaration of Consciousness Movement in expanding through enterprise, entertainment and media  will be shown constant appreciation.

Sign & Declare Consciousness: www.signdc.org  




We have three questions for you:

1) Do you ever feel that the problems facing humanity are just so huge that the world situation seems hopeless?

2) Do you ever wish that all of us conscious people could unite to take positive action to solve the world's problems?

3) If there was a simple way to begin to make that change possible that costs only $1 , would you want to do it?

We believe Yes We the People can! 

Consciousness is the Answer. 

 HOW DO WE DO IT?

The Declaration of Consciousness Movement calls for a unified intent to address, create and implement solutions for these global issues through Technology,
Team, Global collaborative strategies with grassroot activism.  

This campaign, we are raising funds to develop our Technology Platform. 

BE CONSCIOUSNESS phone/online App will give you access  to the best of inspiring and empowering Consciousness at the Touch of a Finger


Self-Empowerment, Movies and Documentaries - Content - which are all designed to enlighten your awareness.  The Be Consciousness App will also provide you with the ability to nominate and suggest content that inspires you.  Our future app will empower you to contribute, share, market and monetize Your creative Talents and Gifts to the Globe. 


Your $1 contribution gives you a Premium membership of the  Be Consciousness App .  You will receive free Premium Membership level for two years  - limited to the first 100,000 contributors of this campaign.  


Be a Pioneer of Consciousness and support this Movement.


The Declaration of Consciousness has a global mission to acquire 1 billion signatures from citizens of the earth with the intention to create a radical shift of consciousness on the planet based on the following guiding principles:

We The People of Earth Declare:

• Non-Violence / Ahimsa Principle: Planetary peace can only occur when we individually and collectively choose to BE and live in peace, honoring All as One.

• Equality for All and the Empowerment of Women: As All are One, it is imperative to uphold and honor all women as reverently equal within society and our cultural worldviews.

• Universal Freedom: Our Oneness and collective evolution can only be achieved when we honor the rights of all to live free of any and all forms of subjugation so as to wholly and completely express a state of self-realized Consciousness.

• Harm no Child: The future of our planet and generations to come depends on how we dutifully protect each child’s innocence and mindfully nurture the potential of each child, as a future leader in Consciousness.

• Honor Our Elders: Each of our elders is a wisdom keeper, deserving of our mindful respect and most compassionate caring.

• Inspire Creativity and Empower Innovation: The evolutionary advancement of our collective Consciousness and the development of all scientific and/or technological achievements which better our world, can only occur when society supports, honors and nurtures the development of creativity and innovation.

• Consciousness and Ethics of Commerce: The wellbeing of all people and the equitable sustainability of all societies depends on the conscious development and implementation of commerce that upholds to the principle of contributing toward planetary good before an intent to generate profit.

• Ecological Preservation and Climate Change: Each life-form on our planet depends on our Consciousness that reverently cares over each of the environmental elements that shape our global climate and sustains all life.

• Spiritual Freedom and Unity: Each person on our planet holds the potential of contributing towards a greater good in our world, thus they are deserving of our collective support in the attainment of their most advanced Consciousness.



The Declaration of Consciousness Movement is the evolution of the Declaration of Independence in our times. We the People of Planet Earth collectively know that there are a number of global issues that are impacting our safety, wellbeing and peaceful co-existence.  The Declaration of Consciousness Movement calls for a unified intent to address, create and implement solutions for these global issues. Consciousness is the Answer.  

Intentional Acts of Consciousness creates the reality we each desire. 

The Movement  is asking all citizens of Earth to be a part of the growing Vision with a pledge of at least $1 to support their final goal of 1 million dollars. With technology and the power of Each of Us Co-Creating, we will reach consciousness through enterprise, entertainment and media. We will be the collective voice of all Global Conscious Aspirations. 

The funds will help create the most advanced transformational technology to build global online platforms, our Be  Consciousness App along with mobile hubs to access, nominate and award the most Conscious People, Ideas, Leaders, Enterprises, Entertainment and Media. Our online hub will be an active Conscious Social Media platform bringing conscious people together globally to create multi-generational change and transformation for all of humanity. 

Make your contribution today and have your name added to our growing list of signatures on the Declaration of Consciousness Movement. With your support we can get the Consciousness integrated and adopted by  governments that cares for its people- around the world. Global peace and prosperity will be a natural outcome. 

Technical development of our world-wide online platform to raise Awareness in every country with the best hardware and software for multi-media programming,  administrative management, staffing for our core teams, public relations and the promotion of the Movement through education, events, summits, and news media outlets.

SIGN & DECLARE CONSCIOUSNESS!

[The Declaration of Consciousness Movement signed in London on Dec 21st 2012, leaving Heathrow back to USA]


For those of you feeling called to contribute more than $1 we offer an outstanding selection of gifts and sponsor packages ranging from $9 - $9,999. You'll find the various perks listed on the right of this page along with more details below. 

Thank you for your support! Every effort counts.

 Please use the IndieGoGo Share tools located below the pitch video to share this project with your email list and social networks. Together we will change the world. 

SIGN & DECLARE CONSCIOUSNESS!

www.SignDC.org



Additional Perk Info

               

                    

Details of our PERKS:

I Am Consciousness Wristband/Buttons: God/Source/Infinity is Consciousness. When we state "I Am Consciousness", we are able think from the highest perspective and create a reality that is magnificent, pure and good. 

Declaration of Consciousness Scroll: In the"Declaration of Consciousness", when we declare consciousness and speak the words, "I Am" we are simply stating to the universe that we are infinite wise beings of vast potential having the human experience. The Declaration of Consciousness calls for a unified effort by individuals, organizations and countries to work together to create a safe environment, protect nature and protect the planet. We the people declare our inalienable rights to live on a safer, cleaner and more peaceful planet! 

"Quotes from the Masters" Book: The Masters of the past reach out to all the future through the immortal wisdom of Consciousness. We have compiled select quotes of Masters whose consciousness we inherit through our declaration and affirmation that we are the Ones we have been waiting for. 

Our wall of gratitude: We honor You, the pioneers in our debut fundraising campaign. As we set our objective to obtain over 10 million signatures, You, the pioneers will be accorded the first mention on our Wall of Gratitude. Your website you opt to list on our site will be seen by many conscious beings for years to come. 

Ayurvedic Copper Drinking Cup: Drink energized water and think with clarity- according to Ayurveda, India's ancient system of natural healing, drinking from the ayurvedic copper metal cup prevents aging. The Oligo-dynamic effect of copper, destroys undesirable virus and bacteria.

Mastery of Consciousness Book: This is an inspiring and uplifting book  from the mystical yogic science of India. The book contains 108 nuggets of life- transforming wisdom; 108 illumined pictures, yogic insights into consciousness, yoga, meditation and life alongside an interview with the author, Tapasyogi Nandhi.

118 Masters of Consciousness Collage Poster: Napolean Hill, one of America's most influential writers, explained how the images of Masters can carry transformative blessings  -“To win the big stakes in this changed world, you must catch the spirit of the great pioneers of the past, whose dreams have given to civilization all that it has of value". Our collage of 118 Masters serve to create positive influence, inspiration and guidance. 

3 Magic Words DVD: This globally acclaimed movie is life changing in its message of Consciousness. What if you woke up with amnesia? What if you had no recollection of who you were in the past? What if you had to look deep within to find the answer to life's biggest question, "Who am I"? Using science, geometry, nature and spirituality, 3 Magic Words examines this question as it is explored further by metaphysical experts. These guests range from best-selling new-age authors to spiritual leaders, and even children.

3 Magic Words Book:  This book is a Beginner's Guide into the world of Metaphysics. War, poverty, pollution, prejudice and human injustice are still going on today because we currently live in a world where separation rules the collective consciousness.  This separation consciousness has caused man to identity with his religion causing a worldwide distortion of spirituality.  3 Magic Words the book explores the secret teachings of all the great spiritual geniuses of our time and reveals the common theme throughout all of them.  

3 Magic Words Sound Track CD: Yoga/Meditation sound track from the movie from musical artists, Turiya Nada (Nandhi) and Amoraea Dreamseed.

Cave of the Siddhars Music CD by Turiya Nada: Siddhar mantra chants of the enlightened yogis of South India with the didgeridoo, harp and percussion. CD includes 12 page booklet including the chants and an insight into the mystical yogi traditions. 

Invoke the Masters Music CD by Turiya Nada: CD One: Nandhi chants the sacred mantras woven with the didgeridoo, harp, singing bowls, djembe, udu, gongs, flute and other instruments. CD Two: Original recording of Siddhar Rajaswamy invoking the Siddhars, the Accomplished Yogi Masters.

Arakara: Ecstasy of the Awake Music CD by Turiya Nada: Fusion of the rapturous, ancient chants of India's Siddhar sages with 21st century electronic soundscapes.

Gold-plated Lamp of the Awake: This special lamp from India:  is made of panchloha- the five metal alloy that is considered sacred for worship items. 6.75 inches height x 4.25 inches base width

Yantra of Success -Six Pointed Star Pendant: 14 karat Gold Large Size: 7/8"

HELP US REACH OUR GOAL!!!!

Global peace and prosperity will be a natural outcome. Technical development of our world-wide online platform to raise Awareness in every country with the best hardware and software for multi-media programming,  administrative management, staffing for our core teams, public relations and the promotion of the Movement through education, events, summits, and news media outlets.SIGN & DECLARE CONSCIOUSNESS![The Declaration of Consciousness Movement signed in London on Dec 21st 2012, leaving Heathrow back to USA]For those of you feeling called to contribute more than $1 we offer an outstanding selection of gifts and sponsor packages ranging from $9 - $9,999. You'll find the various perks listed on the right of this page along with more details below. Thank you for your support! Every effort counts. Please use the IndieGoGo Share tools located below the pitch video to share this project with your email list and social networks. Together we will change the world. SIGN & DECLARE CONSCIOUSNESS!www.SignDC.org
Additional Perk Info


                                   Details of our PERKS:I Am Consciousness Wristband/Buttons: God/Source/Infinity is Consciousness. When we state "I Am Consciousness", we are able think from the highest perspective and create a reality that is magnificent, pure and good. Declaration of Consciousness Scroll: In the"Declaration of Consciousness", when we declare consciousness and speak the words, "I Am" we are simply stating to the universe that we are infinite wise beings of vast potential having the human experience. The Declaration of Consciousness calls for a unified effort by individuals, organizations and countries to work together to create a safe environment, protect nature and protect the planet. We the people declare our inalienable rights to live on a safer, cleaner and more peaceful planet! "Quotes from the Masters" Book: The Masters of the past reach out to all the future through the immortal wisdom of Consciousness. We have compiled select quotes of Masters whose consciousness we inherit through our declaration and affirmation that we are the Ones we have been waiting for. Our wall of gratitude: We honor You, the pioneers in our debut fundraising campaign. As we set our objective to obtain over 10 million signatures, You, the pioneers will be accorded the first mention on our Wall of Gratitude. Your website you opt to list on our site will be seen by many conscious beings for years to come. Ayurvedic Copper Drinking Cup: Drink energized water and think with clarity- according to Ayurveda, India's ancient system of natural healing, drinking from the ayurvedic copper metal cup prevents aging. The Oligo-dynamic effect of copper, destroys undesirable virus and bacteria.Mastery of Consciousness Book: This is an inspiring and uplifting book  from the mystical yogic science of India. The book contains 108 nuggets of life- transforming wisdom; 108 illumined pictures, yogic insights into consciousness, yoga, meditation and life alongside an interview with the author, Tapasyogi Nandhi.118 Masters of Consciousness Collage Poster: Napolean Hill, one of America's most influential writers, explained how the images of Masters can carry transformative blessings  -“To win the big stakes in this changed world, you must catch the spirit of the great pioneers of the past, whose dreams have given to civilization all that it has of value". Our collage of 118 Masters serve to create positive influence, inspiration and guidance. 3 Magic Words DVD: This globally acclaimed movie is life changing in its message of Consciousness. What if you woke up with amnesia? What if you had no recollection of who you were in the past? What if you had to look deep within to find the answer to life's biggest question, "Who am I"? Using science, geometry, nature and spirituality, 3 Magic Words examines this question as it is explored further by metaphysical experts. These guests range from best-selling new-age authors to spiritual leaders, and even children.3 Magic Words Book:  This book is a Beginner's Guide into the world of Metaphysics. War, poverty, pollution, prejudice and human injustice are still going on today because we currently live in a world where separation rules the collective consciousness.  This separation consciousness has caused man to identity with his religion causing a worldwide distortion of spirituality.  3 Magic Words the book explores the secret teachings of all the great spiritual geniuses of our time and reveals the common theme throughout all of them.  3 Magic Words Sound Track CD: Yoga/Meditation sound track from the movie from musical artists, Turiya Nada (Nandhi) and Amoraea Dreamseed.
Cave of the Siddhars Music CD by Turiya Nada: Siddhar mantra chants of the enlightened yogis of South India with the didgeridoo, harp and percussion. CD includes 12 page booklet including the chants and an insight into the mystical yogi traditions. 
Invoke the Masters Music CD by Turiya Nada: CD One: Nandhi chants the sacred mantras woven with the didgeridoo, harp, singing bowls, djembe, udu, gongs, flute and other instruments. CD Two: Original recording of Siddhar Rajaswamy invoking the Siddhars, the Accomplished Yogi Masters.
Arakara: Ecstasy of the Awake Music CD by Turiya Nada: Fusion of the rapturous, ancient chants of India's Siddhar sages with 21st century electronic soundscapes.Gold-plated Lamp of the Awake: This special lamp from India:  is made of panchloha- the five metal alloy that is considered sacred for worship items. 6.75 inches height x 4.25 inches base widthYantra of Success -Six Pointed Star Pendant: 14 karat Gold Large Size: 7/8"
HELP US REACH OUR GOAL!!!!

story:
Greetings and Salutations, Human!

==='Your WoW!' "'is'" 'Your Burn' 'CULTure'===

The Pitch: 

I am a Lord Regent Commander of John Frum's Intergalactic Space-Shamans.  HAIL CARGO!  I have been stationed on your fine planet UNDERCOVER...to bring forth a rouge art project to an art festival in northern Nevada later this month.  The idea....whilst classified....is available TO YOU, RIGHT HERE, RIGHT NOW.  bee immediate and BE.  HERE.  NOW.  

You, of course, are naturally sworn to secrecy simply by reading this.  So.....SHHHHnstuff.  So....here it is!!  The idea jargon-code:  Build some awesome painted-over Sonotube™ lamp pillars with a mushroom-lookin' thing at the top made entirely of cheap dollar store early 21st century cargo-cult junk (with a compartment you can open up on top so a gift repository/gift-exchange can be inside) and illuminate it from both the mushroom and INSIDE the sharpie-laden-open-canvas-Sonotube™, whereon back-lit displayed in a cutout in the Sonotube™ (which is super sturdy, btw) will be various art-snippits of Dr. Richard Alpert's Best’selling’ book "Be Here Now"....which are pretty trippy and deep and Zen™ and stuff by themselves....and there will be 14 Sonotube™ mushroom cargo column things all the way Beyond Midnight in Deep Playa leading to....a final station….special ending PVC thing….that can not even be reveled in this SECRET COMMUNIQUE!!!  IT'S THAT ROUGE/SECRET!!!  Sooooo *breathes* SSSSSssssssssshhhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!!


In-Cog NEETO.


*btw, if any of that was confusing, it's okay.  It's not well formulated in delivery because of a breakdown in the Langua-CULTuration Translation Code on which the previous thought was translated from by the Inter-SEER John Frum Cosmic Meta-ultra-inLink.  It happens with THE STRANGE™ sometimes...

I have 98% of the physical parts needed to make this possible.  I have all the things I need to survive On-Playa. However....

The Glitch:


I neglected to buy the power source to these art-beacons and my spaceship's human-money transcorpus induction machine broke and I find myself with only enough Human Currency to go to this art festival in northern Nevada, exist, and return to my Homebase to re-assume my Undercover roll as a typical employed Human.

I have heard that the Human AA Battery is compatible with my inter-stellar equipment.  I shall need to procure:




* 3 batteries x lamp x day, 15 lamps, 6 days = 270 batteries.

* A small amount of paint to paint over Sonotube™ Company-Brand Labels

* 14x 1 foot x 9 inch wooden boards to secure the Sonotube™ into and anchor

*?  (and if funding allows, 4x 4-way PVC connector, 4x 60 degree elbows and some 1-1/2" PVC pipe for creating the ending art piece of ULTRA SECRECYofwhichihaveeverythingforexceptthepvcbuticanworkwithoutthisbutitWOULDbereallycool)


But what is essential are the AA batteries.  I report to the Playa Early on the 9th but will let this campaign go whilst I am away in the Desert.  I could probably pull it off with a minimum of $100 and comfortably with $200.  Anything over $500, i'll have to give back as there wouldn't be a need to impact any more on your Human Money Ecosystem.  (we try not to interfere with your formal methods of organization.  we focus our evolutionary tricks on the CULTure)

I need you humans to give me a jump start.  I need your Light for my Deep-Playa Alien-Transformation CommUNICOcation-Heliolamps......D-PATCH........or for something more fragrant for Human minds.....how about "Big-Bada-Boomers".  Batteries for the Big-Bada-Boomers...

  • "Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you." - 100 okay, 200 great, 500 enough already!
  • BIG
  • BA-DA!
    BOOM???
    • Klaatu.
    • Barada.
    • Nikto.

 

The Impact

I can not get into the details of our Plans for your species...however, these lamps are well-thought out and well-designed.  They are designed for ILLUMINATION.  They will be art-interactive.  There will be some that bear gifts.  And some that bear gifting commons.  They will be in a row....so as my people, praise Cargo, may bear witness to such wondering revelations that shall surely come, by the will of John Frum.

BE MY JOHN FRUM.  (*psst*....i believe.)

  • I
  • NEED
  • CARGO!

The Self

Honestly, i'm bankrolling this idea before I even go and hope like hell there is money to get back home with.  Unwise, sure, but *I BELIEVE*.  I'm going to be ON PLAYA on the 9th building another glorious impermanent communally reverend structure……Galactic evolution stuff and what not.  I will probably be coming back to the world-at-large in early September.  I hope to have enough gas to make it back.  Otherwise, Reno's home!  I have a job-certificate-human-identity-thing that will quickly me to procure employment in Reno.  Although, i'd like to make it back to my Home Base.  All my stuff’s there.  But, hey……."priorities", right?  The Mission Must Come Rirst.  And that mission is to be as effective as possible during my stay and Black Rock...for the sake of all you humans.  You want Cargo?  Then………HAIL JOHN FRUM!

?EDIR A DEEN

(If you'd like to find me, i'll be at the Temple at Sunset.  Look for the Weird-lookin' Mystic Bearded Guy....)

The Others

Do you see what I see?
Come along with me
Second Star to the ???
In Dust we Trust John Frum the Just.....to bear forth
THE CAAAAAARGOOOOO!

ZOOOOooooooooommmmmMMM! *away!*



....no, but seriously, thank you all for doing whatever you can...even if that is 'Sharing'.  That's cool enough by me.  Just....putting this out there.  I want to have this happen.  I'm already in so much....

I'd like to see it GO

-The Sharpie™ Shaman-

story:
jacob DID this, is an 11 year old artist who is reaching for his dreams. He has been a guest in artist alley at several small local conventions, and he wants to raise enough money (on his own), to get into artist alley at DragonCon 2014. He has received overwhelming support from the local community, as well as, some online friends and social media. He has also gotten support from a few celebrities such as mc chris. Here is one of the drawings that he did for mc.

Jacob's unique style and innocent perspective is a total delight for people of all ages, with instant classics like "Taco Love"

 and popular designs like "Batman with Candy"

It is easy to see the appeal and artistic purity of this young artist. When you support jacob DID this, you not only get artwork or a t-shirt, you get good feels. 



Jacob has hundreds of designs and custom artwork in his catalog. Too many to list here all at once. Every week we will add more artwork to the collection. There will be a master catalog that you can pick from when specifying your selections. All of his artwork will be released in his book. Jacob DID this!

story:
My name is Mariana Russell. I am an artist living and working in Wisconsin. I have been accepted to an artist residency at a non profit organization called La Postiza, an independent art production and contemporary thinking center.
Artist residencies exist to invite artists to have time and space away from their usual environment, obligations, and distractions to have concentrated time to reflect, research, and produce work. I will be working and living in Murcia Spain for three months, concentrating on new work and new concepts.

If you are interested in a more in depth description of my objectives, timeline, and what I will be working on I am happy to share that with you. Just let me know!
All the money raised from this campaign will go to transportation to and from Spain (that is if I decide to come home) and whatever is leftover will cover some food costs.

This program would be and extremely significant opportunity at this point in my career as I have just not only graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts, but also exhibited my first two-person show at a commercial gallery.  It would give me an opportunity to gain a deeper understanding of my artistic practice and would be an excellent environment to start new work in in hopes to show at other galleries in addition to my upcoming solo show in 2015. It would contribute to establishing and growing a working practice outside of the academic setting.

    For more information about me and my work, feel free to visit my website -> www.marianarussell.com or check out my instagram -> marianarussellart or my facebook page -> https://www.facebook.com/marianarussellart

    I would greatly appreciate if you would share this with your friends to get me that much closer to my goal, my dream.

story:
Short Summary

Troy Macklin is a Bay Area native and a 2008 alumnus of The Julliard School where he recieved his Bachelor of Fine Arts in Dance. Several years ago he relocated back to the Bay Area and found himself entering the generous Shawl-Anderson Dance Center and East Bay dance scene. Before he knew it he was instructing, choreographing, dancing and opening himself up to the many possibilites that Shawl-Anderson has to offer. Troy has become a 2013 Artist-In-Resident at Shawl and has been inspired by his many relationships he has built within this community. Dancers & visual arts have been his source of inspiration throughout this process and by fostering opportunites through collaborations, Release Your Quest has been "coming to fruition!" 

With artists Leah Curran, Jerry Christopher Lin, Vera Schwegler, Rebecca Demotte & Olivia Llepes sharing their given talents, WE are truly seeking many Quests.

Release Your Quest

Choreographed & created by Troy Macklin in collaboration with Dancers, Visual Artists & a Musician

August 9-11, 2013 @ 8PM

Shawl-Anderson Dance Center 

2704 Alcatraz Avenue, Berkeley

Release Your Quest is being created while In Residence at Shawl-Anderson Dance Center and is a part of Dance Up Close/East Bay. 

What We Need & What You Get

Release Your Quest is seeking any and all support from individuals who would like to give to our project & help us share with our East Bay communities.

We will utilize any funds given to support the projects' limited budget & it's artistic collaborators.

We are building an evening of sharing art with the East Bay communities :)

Come join in this evening of community building through artistic expression!

The Impact

Collaborative artists involved in this Residency are giving their time to this project. This experience is allowing artists to branch out and utilize other medians of artistic expression to inspire, express and create. Release Your Quest gives individuals involded an opportunity to build creative community, learn how different artists create art & share with our communities, allowing the public to inspire and give their energy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Financial contributions are understood to not be the only form of donations towards this project. Release Your Quest invites any and all In Kind Donations and welcomes the involvement of our East Bay communities to check out what we are sharing. If anything just come, experience the fun, bring & share your presence and Enjoy! :)

Remember, you can use the Indiegogo share tools! Share this with your friends, family, anyone you may know! Spread the word! 

See you there! :)

August 9-11, 2013 @ 8PM

Shawl-Anderson Dance Center

2704 Alcatraz Avenue, Berkeley

Tickets $20/$15 Seniors & Students

Purchase tickets online: http://www.quest.brownpapertickets.com

www.troymacklin.org

www.shawl-anderson.org

story:
How can design make for more user-centered programs and public policy? 

Projects like Design for Democracy have begun to show the importance of design in government. Ballot design, polling place layouts, voting technology, and information communication systems all influence the democratic process at the state level. Yet design at the federal level of government is a comparatively unexplored space. While there is growing interest in understanding the applications of design processes and visual problem solving in government, and budding enthusiasm, these conversations remain largely theoretical. 

I have a chance to make these conversations real. Beginning this July, I will serve as the first Designer-in-Residence at the Collaboratory, a new initiative at the U.S. Department of State. The Collaboratory integrates technology and innovative ideas into educational and cultural programs, like the Fulbright program, and serves as a testing ground for new ideas and programs. 

Over the next year, I will use design principles to improve government programs and policies and, crucially, train others in design thinking. I will go to work for nine months to rethink governance at the systems level, redesign communications to connect with new and changing demographics in American and international society, and refine a visual identity for the Collaboratory. My goal is to put ideas into practice and begin to understand how design impacts government and public policy while creating a sustainable design infrastructure within the Collaboratory.

I’ll be joining the Department as a Franklin Fellow — an incredible program that allows professionals in diverse fields to do a year of unpaid public service. The Rhode Island School of Design Maharam STEAM Fellowship has stepped forward to back me — demonstrating how important these ideas are. But this funding only constitutes about half of the funding needed.

With your help, I can be among the first to demonstrate how design practice can make federal government work better for everyone. This is a great way to demonstrate what a difference design processes can make in government. If the program is successful, it’s possible that the Designer-in-Residence position will become a paid, permanent position. 

My experiences and some case studies from our work will be compiled into a comprehensive report that will be made available for those interested in my journey and curious about how design thinking can make government better. I hope that you will consider contributing. All funds will go towards supporting living expenses in Washington, DC as well as production costs for the report.


About Me

I am a recent graduate of the Brown|RISD Dual Degree Program, where I explored design for the public interest while earning degrees in International Relations from Brown University and Printmaking from the Rhode Island School of Design. At the Collaboratory, I will be continuing my career in public service, which began at the Bureau of Engraving and Printing in Washington, DC. In addition to creative pursuits, I enjoy athletic endeavors, traveling, and adding to my collections of printed matter. I spend time deciphering hip-hop lyrics and books written in Italian, and can give great restaurant recommendations for those who find themselves hungry in Providence, Rhode Island. You can see some of my previous work on my portfolio site. Thanks for reading!


The views expressed in this article are those of the author and do not necessarily represent the views of, and should not be attributed to, the U.S. Department of State.
story_txt:
How can design make for more user-centered programs and public policy? 

Projects like Design for Democracy have begun to show the importance of design in government. Ballot design, polling place layouts, voting technology, and information communication systems all influence the democratic process at the state level. Yet design at the federal level of government is a comparatively unexplored space. While there is growing interest in understanding the applications of design processes and visual problem solving in government, and budding enthusiasm, these conversations remain largely theoretical. 


I have a chance to make these conversations real. Beginning this July, I will serve as the first Designer-in-Residence at the Collaboratory, a new initiative at the U.S. Department of State. The Collaboratory integrates technology and innovative ideas into educational and cultural programs, like the Fulbright program, and serves as a testing ground for new ideas and programs. 

Over the next year, I will use design principles to improve government programs and policies and, crucially, train others in design thinking. I will go to work for nine months to rethink governance at the systems level, redesign communications to connect with new and changing demographics in American and international society, and refine a visual identity for the Collaboratory. My goal is to put ideas into practice and begin to understand how design impacts government and public policy while creating a sustainable design infrastructure within the Collaboratory.
















I’ll be joining the Department as a Franklin Fellow — an incredible program that allows professionals in diverse fields to do a year of unpaid public service. The Rhode Island School of Design Maharam STEAM Fellowship has stepped forward to back me — demonstrating how important these ideas are. But this funding only constitutes about half of the funding needed.

With your help, I can be among the first to demonstrate how design practice can make federal government work better for everyone. This is a great way to demonstrate what a difference design processes can make in government. If the program is successful, it’s possible that the Designer-in-Residence position will become a paid, permanent position. 

My experiences and some case studies from our work will be compiled into a comprehensive report that will be made available for those interested in my journey and curious about how design thinking can make government better. I hope that you will consider contributing. All funds will go towards supporting living expenses in Washington, DC as well as production costs for the report.About MeI am a recent graduate of the Brown|RISD Dual Degree Program, where I explored design for the public interest while earning degrees in International Relations from Brown University and Printmaking from the Rhode Island School of Design. At the Collaboratory, I will be continuing my career in public service, which began at the Bureau of Engraving and Printing in Washington, DC. In addition to creative pursuits, I enjoy athletic endeavors, traveling, and adding to my collections of printed matter. I spend time deciphering hip-hop lyrics and books written in Italian, and can give great restaurant recommendations for those who find themselves hungry in Providence, Rhode Island. You can see some of my previous work on my portfolio site. Thanks for reading!The views expressed in this article are those of the author and do not necessarily represent the views of, and should not be attributed to, the U.S. Department of State.

story:
I've spent the past twenty five years immersed in the history of Chicago and the stories of those who have had brushes with the paranormal dimension of the culture and tragedy of the city that has always been my home.   Though I first began writing books out of a desire to record these histories and experiences, I have always felt limited by the written narrative and have lately sought other ways to express my great passion of the people who I call "The Experiencers"  ... those who have personal experience with a world caught between our physical one and the eternity that is out of reach. 

As a little girl, I was always writing poetry, always picking out songs on the piano, always drawing and creating physical art.  In my effort to carve out a career in life, I sought the more "sensible" route of history, aiming to become a teacher.
That plan did not exactly work out.  My first books were so well received by a public thirsty for this dimension of life--and afterlife--that I became permanently sidetracked, writing book after book as the stories flowed in, and starting "Chicago Hauntings" Tours to take people to the locations I chronicled.

This past year, I began creating experimental music with another paranormal investigator and musician.  He said I was a natural and talented in it.  While I was very honored to hear these compliments, I know that I am just starting out and have a lot to learn.  I have, however, become very interested and active in the creation of experimental music, poetry and visual art based on the haunted history of Chicago and beyond. Incorporating Electronic Voice Phenomenon, ambient sound from these locations, sound bytes of music and spoken word recordings from past eras, and my own original music, I have found it very rewarding to create "audio postcards" from these deeply emotional and historic events. 

My very first composition is a track inspired by the "thoughtography" of Ted Serios, a Chicagoan who worked as a bellman at the Hilton Hotel in Chicago in the early 1960s ,who claimed he could imprint Polaroid film with images from his mind. Starting with recordings of Serios and parapsychologist Jule Eisenbud, who studied Ted for years, along with ambient recordings from the Hilton and the Palmer House, where Serios and Eisenbud met, as well as EVP recorded around the original camera and photographs housed in the special collections of the University of Maryland Baltimore County, I added recordings of a Polaroid camera in action, the shutter tripping and the film being ripped out, as well as ice tinkling in a glass (Ted always worked better drunk).  The base or background track is a manipulated version of "Can't Buy Me Love," which was number one on the charts the week Serios and Eisenbud met.  My hope is that some of the excitement and mystery of Ted Serios, as well as his very "Chicago" story, are captured in this short track of about 2 minutes. 

This will be the first release of "Purgatory Press," an institution creating music and books of a less narrative and more experiential variety than my traditional history books--and their more traditional publishers. 

It is my great hope that you will support me as I return to my roots as an aspiring artist and my first loves of expression through visual art, poetry and music.  My goal is to give other researchers, too, a channel through which to express their artistic impulses as paranormal investigators. 

I have planned about a dozen releases for the next two years, most of them 7" flexible phonograph records with accompanying art and notes, which will include a link to an MP3 download.   Each 7" release will cost about 500 dollars for a pressing of 250 copies.  My aim is to have enough supporters to fund several pressings, but even enough support for one would be a wonderful sign to me that I'm on the right track.

I've been writing and creating my entire life, have operated Chicago Hauntings Tours for 12 years, have hosted the Chicago Ghost Conference for 7 years with great success, and my website has been called "one of the most important web sites for local history."  I design everything myself, create and host many creative events every year to bring people together and share ideas about the paranormal in its many expressions, and I am determined, so determined.   Whatever I do works.  I believe it works because people find an outlet for their own beliefs, expressions and fears in the things I do.  Thank you for supporting my work these past two and a half decades!

-Ursula Bielski
founder, Chicago Hauntings, Inc.

story:
Why House prints?

Hello, internet. My name is Tobias Gurl, and I'm a trans man with a short story to share.

Like I imagine many of you reading this did, I grew up reading J.K. Rowling’s Harry Potter books  - acting out wizard duels on the playground, wading through fan fiction, agonizing over where I would have been sorted, etc. I wouldn't have expected the woman who wrote a how-to guide for resisting authoritarianism to have planted her stake on the side of transphobia, but here we are.

Rowling's public platform has the potential to influence policy targeting trans people like me. Even if it doesn't go that far, having someone many of us looked up to turn on us still stings.

Stories, though, are bigger than their authors, and the inspirational symbolism Rowling created can be appreciated outside of her choices. I want to offer those of us who have been rejected art that gets at what we appreciated in the first place, and to use it as an opportunity to fight back against transphobia in a concrete, material way.

Here's how it works:

I want to make these prints free to trans people and anyone who donates to a transgender charity or nonprofit. (Or close to free - I can't afford to eat the cost of shipping.) Once the prints are off the press I'll be offering them on my website and any future conventions where I'm a vendor. All you'll need to do is send me a screencap or photo of your proof of donation (minus credit card or other sensitive information) and I'll send you a promo code that will allow you to order on from your House for free. Additional prints will still come at a cost to the buyer, which is why I'm offering them at a discount as one of my tiers.

Please send me a private message to let me know which print(s) you want with your order, and with your commission request, if applicable.

My local printer of choice, Girlie Press, charges $99 for 200 A7 quality 5x7 prints, which comes out to 50 per House. Including Indiegogo's 5% base fee, cost of gas, and a little rounding up, I'll need to raise $110 to print a modest-sized run. Additional funds raised will go toward increasing the quantity of prints, up to $500 total. Anything beyond that and I'll need to have a word with my printer about options like stickers, which can't happen until after the holidays. If you see the total reach or exceed $500, please consider gifting your money directly to a transgender charity, then sending me your receipt later so I can send you your free print.

Risks & Challenges

Not many. If I don't raise the full amount I'm asking for, I'll just print as many as I can with what I do get. I've successfully completed two prior fundraisers, and have a proven track record on delivering my promises. As with all fan art, there's a small chance I'll be hit with a copyright takedown and will be unable to complete the fundraiser; if that should happen, your money will be refunded with an apology.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not interested in prints for yourself or your loved ones, please consider letting your friends know about the fundraiser, or donating to a transgender cause like the ones below:

  • Mermaids UK
  • Trans Lifeline
  • Transgender Law Center
  • Trans Doe Task Force

story:
Hello! Thank you for being here!

After four years Brian and I are excited to take this next step and open our first storefront space. The shop is in Kenton, our neighborhood in North Portland - a fun up-and-coming part of our quickly growing city! 

 

 

With Brier + Ivy we've been committed to slow and steady growth! 

What started as a small after work hobby quickly turned into something more than either of us ever could have imagined due to your overwhelming response + support. We are passionate about growing this business to meet its full potential and we are excited to continue to do so with all of you. That's what has brought us here today! We have thoughtfully put together several different ways for you to participate in our storefront project. 

 

 

We've got our work cut out for us!

First off, we need to renovate the space! The main projects we have ahead include - 

  • polishing + sealing the concrete floors
  • removing the drop ceiling + refinishing the exposed wood ceiling
  • completing the space with new trim + paint
  • updating the lights 
  • purchasing a flower cooler + finishing touches for the space 
  • and so much more!

 

 

It's been a long journey to get to where we are today

When we started Brier + Ivy we were living in a small studio apartment, working in my parent’s basement, and tetrising all of the materials for weddings in our tiny Prius. From there we have continued to move from my grandma's spare room, back to our apartment + a garage or two! Last season we rented our first studio space and finally got a bigger car to better fit the flowers. We are so grateful for the support from our family and friends, and hope you’ll continue to be a part of the next phase for Brier + Ivy! As we head into our fifth season we could not be more ready or thrilled to create + open this new space. 

 

 

What We’re looking forward to this season 

As we have had more demand coming in than we can meet, our biggest challenge has been having the space + facility to produce all the weddings we want to do! Our new space will not only meet this need but also provide an opportunity to have - 

  • retail space for fresh florals, house plants, gifts, cards + candles. 
  • a space to meet + host our clients + fellow vendors
  • a space for small events such as workshops, showers, intimate parties + rehearsal dinners

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are so grateful for any + all support! We have been so blessed by all the referrals of our friends, clients + family. It's because of all of you that we've made it to this point today! If you would like to participate in another capacity - 

  • share this page on social media
  • spread the word about the new shop! 
  • come visit us once we open - we'll be sure to keep you updated! 

We are SO grateful to you!! Thank you for your time + support!

story:
ArtLayer is here to inspire the little ones to be creative, and remind the big ones the fulfillment of creating something with their own hands.

ArtLayer is a captivating way to keep children and adults away from smart devices, and engaged into the real world – while creating a real 3D art sculpture!

Try an innovative way of creating intricate cardboard sculptures that grows in front of your eyes. A simple, yet mentally-stimulating puzzle that offers hours of real-world fulfillment.

How does it work?

It’s intuitive, yet challenging! Stack layer after layer of cardboard on top of one another while following a certain pattern to create your own innovative art piece.

From simpler designs to complex pieces that take more patience and forward thinking.

That’s why we created an entire collection for kids and for big kids alike.

Our art pieces offer varied levels of mental challenge: from simple designs your child will love, to more intricate pieces meant for adults - or as a collaborative experience.

Once done, you can leave it as it is, or apply an extra layer of paint to add that finishing touch.


ArtLayer STEAM-BOX


 

Bull & Bear

It looks great displayed on any wall, and the wall mount board gives that extra classy touch:

The Challenge Packages

For those with a bit of extra time on their hands

Fun Packages

For those who want to relax and enjoy the experience:

Architecture Packages

For those who want their own mini-iconic building:

Sizes and weights

height / depth / width

How it’s shipped – package as artwork in itself!

All the artwork will be shipped to you in a handcrafted wooden gift box that can afterwards be used as a beautiful functional piece for your desk or library.
 

 

Just a different way to think out of the box while using the cardboard that once might have been a box to create innovative art.

As you see, at ArtLayer we’re a different kind of tinkers!
 

Why love ArtLayer

Remember the joy of making something with your own hands as a kid?

Now think of how proud your little one will be when he’ll be able to solve the puzzle and make his own art piece.

It’s art they can touch and feel, and art they can work on, and watch it grow in front of their eyes. The end result will leave them beaming with the satisfaction of accomplishing something – by themselves or as something they can do it together.

For them is a rewarding project that will let his imagination run wild – with something to brag about in the end. For you it’s an innovative way to introduce him to a fun mental exercise.

Toy and educational tool in the same time

Mental exercise is very important for the development of a healthy mindset.

With Artlayer, kids will be mentally engaged throughout the process of solving the puzzle and building the art piece, while being rewarding with something at the end. Something they can be proud of!

An innovative, rewarding way to keep them off screens and engaged into the real world.

Artlayer helps kids develop better focus and concentration, forward thinking, creativity, artistic skills, and spatial awareness in the real world.

Layer after layer, they can see their own art piece growing in front of their eyes.

The same eyes that will be beaming with satisfaction once the artwork is completed.

Fun for the kid, relaxing for the adult...
Rewarding for both!

ArtLayer is a great way to spend some quality time together.

A fun, productive activity with some amazing mental benefits -  that will keep them happy and engaged for hours at a time. A way to give them a sense of accomplishment.

Also, a life lesson:

 

Safe for children & Safe for the environment

MADE OF 100% RECYCLED CARDBOARD

ArtLayer comes in already-cut patterns, so no cutting is needed, or other tools to be used - only lightweight cardboard layers and glue.

ArtLayer contains non-toxic, natural materials that are child-safe and are also safe for the environment – with the cardboard being easy to recycle if you wish so.

One more thing:  it’s also safe for adults.

Because unlike Legos, your feet won’t scream in pain if you step on one of the layers :)

Why big kids will love it too!

We’re all kids at heart.

That’s why we like tinkering things and creating something we can look at and say:

I made this!

That’s why we decided to extend ArtLayer even further, and create more elaborate pieces that will be engaging and mentally stimulating for adults as well.

Stack layer after layer and let the stress fade away. In the end you’ll feel rewarded and proud that you’ve achieved something with your own hands.

 

Handcrafted art for your display – with you as the artist!

ArtLayer: a way to take creativity to the real world

Not only a relaxing activity, but also a rewarding experience.

How it’s made

Using laser cutting technology, all ArtLayer puzzles come with pre-cut cardboards that require no special tools or skills for assembly.

 

Everything you need comes in the box - even easy to understand instructions in case you get stuck.

Everything will be manufactured in our own production facilities

All ArtLayer items - including the handcrafted box - are produced in Ukraine, Europe.

This way, you’ll have the guarantee of a speedy delivery, and that you’ll get what you pledge for – without flaws, without delays, and without intermediaries.

How we got the idea for ArtLayer

It started with one layer at a time!

In 2018 we set on a mission to explain to everyone how a 3D printer works.

After coming up with several models layered for the real world, we realised that the entire process of building a 3D model from physical layers can turn into an engaging and rewarding activity for kids and big kids alike.

 

 

While in the process of experimenting with various pieces, we realised it has the potential to be a lot more than just stacking up 3D models:

It’s art | It can be a puzzle | It’s mentally stimulating | It’s a way of relaxation

It’s rewarding | It’s an education tool | It’s a decorative piece

Not long after, we started coming up with our art innovative collection.

The Brand behind ArtLayer

We’re called Daisy Sign, and we’re the makers of ArtLayer.

Our history goes way back in 2003, with a small advertisement shop where we produced unusual promotional items for advertising purposes.

Since then, we have worked on a variety of original, non-conventional products  made of both wood and cardboard.

With time, we realized that this is our call, that this is what we want to do - play with wood and cardboard and create something new, and fun, and even artistic.

Something children and adults will enjoy in the real word - away from screens.

We also understood the fulfillment of making something with your own hands, that’s why we try to come with simple and engaging ways to connect with people.

In 2018 we decided to create ArtLayer – to give children and adults a way to make their own unconventional art pieces.

Something real. Something you can build yourself.

Through ArtLayer, we try to remind everyone of the satisfaction of building something with your own hands.

At this moment we have experimented and created 30 types of designs that offer several levels of complexity to engage children, as well as adults.

And we’re not stopping here. That’s why we created this Kickstarter.

To fund our campaign and create more designs and innovative concepts.

One layer at a time…

Layer after layer, they can see their own art piece growing in front of their eyes.
The same eyes that will be beaming with satisfaction once the artwork is completed.

Fun for the kid, relaxing for the adult...Rewarding for both!
ArtLayer is a great way to spend some quality time together.
A fun, productive activity with some amazing mental benefits -  that will keep them happy and engaged for hours at a time. A way to give them a sense of accomplishment.
Also, a life lesson:

 
Safe for children & Safe for the environment
MADE OF 100% RECYCLED CARDBOARD
ArtLayer comes in already-cut patterns, so no cutting is needed, or other tools to be used - only lightweight cardboard layers and glue.

ArtLayer contains non-toxic, natural materials that are child-safe and are also safe for the environment – with the cardboard being easy to recycle if you wish so.
One more thing:  it’s also safe for adults.
Because unlike Legos, your feet won’t scream in pain if you step on one of the layers :)


Why big kids will love it too!
We’re all kids at heart.
That’s why we like tinkering things and creating something we can look at and say:
I made this!


That’s why we decided to extend ArtLayer even further, and create more elaborate pieces that will be engaging and mentally stimulating for adults as well.
Stack layer after layer and let the stress fade away. In the end you’ll feel rewarded and proud that you’ve achieved something with your own hands.
 
Handcrafted art for your display – with you as the artist!
ArtLayer: a way to take creativity to the real world
Not only a relaxing activity, but also a rewarding experience.

How it’s made
Using laser cutting technology, all ArtLayer puzzles come with pre-cut cardboards that require no special tools or skills for assembly.
 
Everything you need comes in the box - even easy to understand instructions in case you get stuck.
Everything will be manufactured in our own production facilities
All ArtLayer items - including the handcrafted box - are produced in Ukraine, Europe.
This way, you’ll have the guarantee of a speedy delivery, and that you’ll get what you pledge for – without flaws, without delays, and without intermediaries.

How we got the idea for ArtLayer
It started with one layer at a time!
In 2018 we set on a mission to explain to everyone how a 3D printer works.
After coming up with several models layered for the real world, we realised that the entire process of building a 3D model from physical layers can turn into an engaging and rewarding activity for kids and big kids alike.
 
 
While in the process of experimenting with various pieces, we realised it has the potential to be a lot more than just stacking up 3D models:
It’s art | It can be a puzzle | It’s mentally stimulating | It’s a way of relaxation
It’s rewarding | It’s an education tool | It’s a decorative piece
Not long after, we started coming up with our art innovative collection.

The Brand behind ArtLayer
We’re called Daisy Sign, and we’re the makers of ArtLayer.
Our history goes way back in 2003, with a small advertisement shop where we produced unusual promotional items for advertising purposes.
Since then, we have worked on a variety of original, non-conventional products  made of both wood and cardboard.

With time, we realized that this is our call, that this is what we want to do - play with wood and cardboard and create something new, and fun, and even artistic.
Something children and adults will enjoy in the real word - away from screens.
We also understood the fulfillment of making something with your own hands, that’s why we try to come with simple and engaging ways to connect with people.

In 2018 we decided to create ArtLayer – to give children and adults a way to make their own unconventional art pieces.
Something real. Something you can build yourself.
Through ArtLayer, we try to remind everyone of the satisfaction of building something with your own hands.
At this moment we have experimented and created 30 types of designs that offer several levels of complexity to engage children, as well as adults.
And we’re not stopping here. That’s why we created this Kickstarter.
To fund our campaign and create more designs and innovative concepts.
One layer at a time…

story:
The Artwork 

Years ago, I literally dreamt of an art project. 1:23 came to me fully formed, with all of its details, in one striking image. It required that I ask twenty-three male models to appear in the nude for a photo shoot at my studio in Bushwick, Brooklyn. I asked each volunteer to bring an object that both embodies a side of his personality and acts as a prop for his penis. Initially I wondered if anyone would reply. Who knew that men would love the idea and sign-up in droves? Five of the initial images in the series are above. When completed 1:23 will be an immersive, visual representation of the dating world for women who date men. To portray this reality honestly, Max agreed to hold a sword to represent the one in twenty-three men who rape women on college campuses across the U.S. (Mary Koss, 1987). The show is a work of art and advocacy intended to increase awareness of the rape epidemic.

About the Project

Photography confers an objectifying gaze. My use of the medium as a female artist radically reverses the power dynamics inherent in the majority of rape. Victim blaming logic is also reversed in this project by looking squarely at the perpetrators. Damage created in the social world needs to be healed in the social world, and art has the capacity to transform hate into beauty.  The nudity of the project reveals the character of the rapist and creates an environment of vulnerability and trust during the photographic process that can have a healing effect for survivors.

One of the largest contributions this project has made is the community it has created around sexual violence and its integration of personal experience. Several survivors have worked on this project in a variety of ways and dozens of instances of rape trauma have been processed. This emotional work adds a unique and powerful depth to the art.  

About the Artist 

Jean Haluska is an artist and educator with her Masters degree in art who teaches in NYC public schools. She is also a volunteer advocate who goes to a Manhattan hospital in the middle of the night to help survivors of rape and domestic violence re-establish safety and control in their personal environment. Jean is a queer, cis gendered woman and this project is her vision of a social problem that effects all genders. 

A project like this is not possible without a large team of extremely talented individuals. She is greatly indebted to over 30 people who have donated hundreds of hours of their time to make this project a success. Please check out the credits below. 

Why We Need Your Support 

Your contributions will allow us to:

- Rent a camera capable of producing six foot images ($533.39)

- Pay the rest of the models ($570)

- Print life-sized images ($6,500)

- Mount the images ($500)

- Pay for the creation of perks ($2,001.5)

- Rent the gallery for 2 days ($1,000)

- Pay Indigogo and credit card fees (about $1,345)

Total: $12,449.89

The Exhibition open will be from 8-9:30pm on November 3rd, 2018 at 112 Waterbury Street Brooklyn, NY 11206. All are welcome. The reception will be streamed live for all of those who can’t attend

My collaborators and I hope you are as passionate about art and raising awareness as we are. If you are unable to donate, you can still contribute to this campaign by sharing this URL with everyone you know.

 
Credits

Jean Haluska (art/photography, concept)

Atsushi Takaoka (lighting design for photography)

David Ruiz (film maker: director, writer, camera work, lighting, editing, graphics)

Vince, Max Bruno, Frank Contreras, Davis Whitfield, David Billingsley, Enrique Vidal, Gymnos Alitheia, Keith Mackler, Kenneth Campbell, Steve Soul, Hardy Brooklyn (models)

Chauntel Gerdes (expert commentary)

Matthew Sandusky, Sara Demars, Brandon Weaver, Jeannette Estima, Christina Tesoro, Natalie Moore De Gennaro (writers)

Oheine Porter (logo, graphic design, gifts, strategist, and social media marketing)

Lucelenia Amparo and Paul Nocera (marketing)

Eric Camper (3D model, live streaming)

Katrina Stingers (gift comic, photo retouching)

Realph Saintil (strategist and incredible enthusiast)

Lourdes Baez, Stephanie Huffaker, Lauren Malinofsky, Giselle Regalado, Julia Cavagna, Matthew Sandusky, Margaret Stone, Sara Demars, Nae James, Jessica Jackson, Jeanette Estima, Ruthie Birger (chaperones).

Bi Tom, Michelle Southerland (consultant)

Contact/ Mailinglist  jeanhaluska@gmail.com

 
More Information
To continue the conversation here is more expert commentary from Chauntel Gerdes

story:
We are the first global social media alliance of dogs (and one cat) that unite to support shelters and bring joy with limited edition playing cards.

The cutest dogs and cat (joker) have united in a never seen @dogsalliance to work together towards the support of WIRES of Australia, and rehabilitate and preserve Australian wildlife.

Each of them has selected their best Instagram picture to produce a limited edition series playing cards sketched by the talented Australian artist Lynda Faulkner. A timeless and unique memory!

Have fun with family and friends playing cards with the same guys that make you smile all day. 

 

 

 

But, why 13 dogs and one cat?

 

Because we realized that the best way to include a big group of these Instagram celebrities in one funny and enjoyable product was a deck of cards. If you are asking why 13 dogs and one cat the reason is that we needed a Joker to rule them all!

 

 

We have been selling decks of cards and donating part of the revenues to the Hong Kong Dog Rescue Shelter (HKDRS). This time, our help will go to support the job of WIRES in Australia after the terrible bush fires that have been happening in the last months. 

 

                                            
 

Now join us and get your cards, have a laugh with your family and friends and use them as a gift that will always draw a smile :)

 

 

 

In the last months, Australia has been suffering one of the worst sets of bushfires in its history devastating thousands of hectares.

 

 

Many animals were already struggling with a lack of water and food due to a terrible drought. With the fires destroying unprecedented amounts of habitat, food shortages have increased and lack of suitable habitat will be a significant long-term challenge for surviving wildlife.

It is impossible to know how many animals have died but rough estimations say that over 1 billion since September.

 

 

Not all heroes wear a cap

 

WIRES (NSW Wildlife Information, Rescue and Education Service Inc.) has been rescuing and caring for wildlife for over 30 years and is the largest wildlife rescue organization in Australia. 

WIRES mission is to actively rehabilitate and preserve Australian wildlife and inspire others to do the same. They are passionate about supporting smaller volunteer organizations in the wildlife sector with the same mission, as well as Universities, Veterinary Associations and other leading scientific and environmental groups. 

In the last 5 years WIRES has been working with organizations including WWF, National Parks Association, Humane Society International, The Wilderness Society, Nature Conservation Council, Birdlife, RSPCA, Animal Welfare League and IFAW and we thank these organizations for their significant ongoing contribution to the wildlife rehabilitation sector.

In response to the tragic toll of the catastrophic fires and drought on wildlife, WIRES is actively pursuing significant opportunities to help wildlife more broadly across Australia, including partnering on projects to improve long-term outcomes for native animals.

 

  • Photo credit: WIRES

 

The @DogsAlliance has come up with a plan to support WIRES in their job. And guess what? We need you!

We have developed a beautiful limited edition playing cards deck with all the members of the @DogsAlliance specially painted by Australian artist Lynda Faulkner.

 

 

We will be donating a percentage of each sale of this campaign to WIRES in order to help with our grain of sand in this catastrophe. The amount (percentage) to be donated will escalate as we get more sales. With this, our stretch goals are linked to a bigger percentage of the sale that goes to the final donation.

 

Stretch goals:

 

·         If between 200 - 499 packs of cards are sold then we can fund and donate 25% of all sales to WIRES.

·         If between 500 and 999 packs of cards are sold then 27,5% of all sales will be donated to WIRES.

·         If between 1.000 and 2.499 packs of cards are sold then 30% of all sales will be donated to WIRES.

·         If between 2.500 and 9.999 packs of cards are sold then 32,5% of all sales will be donated to WIRES.

·         If more than 10.000 packs of cards are sold then 35% of all sales will be donated to WIRES.

 

 

 

 

 

Lynda Faulkner

 

·         Lynda Faulkner

Art, travel and nature are three of Lynda’s favourite things. Lynda is a self taught artist specialising in acrylics. Most of her works are commission pieces where she is entrusted to portray peoples much loved pets. Born in Ipswich, Australia, Lynda has always had a love of art. From the very first time she was able to hold a pencil she was experimenting with techniques and has won several awards during her journey. Lynda spent many years living on a remote water pumping station in Central Queensland. Often cut off from neighbours and the town by floodwaters gave her time to study her vast environment. “Living such an isolated lifestyle made me really see and feel the colours, light and movement around me. This experience has enabled me to portray my subjects in a way that often surprise but engage the viewer.” In a world of conflict Lynda makes art that makes people smile. “In my dreams I am swimming in bold colours. They don’t blend but stay pure and clean. I breathe them, I feel them and I live them. Colour is my passion.”

 

 

 

Claudia, Jorge & Jager

 

 

 

 

 

·         Design: The cards are beautifully crafted and include all the members of the @DogsAlliance in the royal cards, aces and jokers!

·         Quality: We are working with the best card manufacturer to make sure these cards last forever! The cards are plastic, waterproof and durable... It doesn't matter how messy the playing gets!

 

 

 

 

 

 

We can’t thank you enough for your help here. Please make sure to share this campaign with your friends and family and let's put together this small grain of sand while we enjoy a good laugh with the @DogsAlliance!

story:
Short Summary:

We are literally having technical difficulties with our click and pledge campaign! We've had 2 very successful Indiegogo campaigns over the last 2 seasons but we tried a different platform and just aren't having a fabulous run of it - so WE'RE BACK!

These mid season fundraisers are what allows us to keep doing the work we do. Your donation at any level is so very appreciated and truly makes a big difference for a small organization like us. We're volunteer run, we support and present experimental and underground artists, and in a major city like Seattle it takes spaces of all sizes and more than dreams to keep an arts community thriving.

We're launching this bare bones style and will continue to add content, but we wanted to get it up and running so you can donate today!
