story:
In Search of the Frightening & Beautiful: To the Bottom of the World

My name is Heather Johnson. I've been a working visual artist for close to 25 years, inspired by the landscape and the feeling I get when I travel through it.

It's been nearly two years since I first launched In Search of the Frightening and Beautiful, my ongoing motorcycle journey and visual art project. It all started in 2012 with an invitation to the BoxoHOUSE artist residency program in Joshua Tree, CA. The invitation became a departure point for something massive. Since then, I have ridden alone over 25,000 miles and have left 30 small gifts everywhere in the form of hand-embroidered art works, dropped in the landscapes of the United States and Mexico, for random folks to encounter and keep. 

I have had experiences too profound to describe. I've ridden through monsoons. Met total strangers who've saved my life. Crashed several times on muddy, rocky, rutted dirt roads. And made many new friends, whose words and actions will stay with me for the rest of my life. (Read about much of this on the project blog, here.)

IN SEARCH OF THE FRIGHTENING & BEAUTIFUL is motivated by a need for connection and understanding in a world governed too frequently by fear, ignorance and mistrust. It crosses geographic and cultural boundaries,  leaving bits of humanity in its wake in the form of intimate, painstakingly-made gestures let loose in the landscape, set adrift in the world to change hands, context and meaning.

                                    

                                    

Since March 2013, I have made 25 new works of art based on experiences from my journey, which have been shown in four exhibitions in New York, Mexico and California. (For more information about my work and art practice, see  http://heatherLjohnson.com.)

I've given lectures at two universities, conducting a workshop for students at one of them. I've just completed the first frightening and beautiful book, hot off the press and ready to ship. Articles have been written, the Facebook page is active and the project's audience is growing, confirming the need to keep it alive. You could say I have unfinished business to take care of.

NEXT MONTH I WILL HEAD SOUTH AGAIN, this time much farther, as far as resources will allow, toward the bottom of the southern hemisphere. I will venture back down through Mexico, into Guatemala, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, Panama and with a little luck, across the Darien Gap into Colombia and beyond. I'll leave in my wake a trail of new pieces, embroidered with motorcycle body parts and bits of text describing observations I've collected so far on the journey... small bits of humanity intended to coincide with the lives of total strangers, whose cultures and languages different from my own. When I return, I'll continue to grow what I've started, incorporating what I've learned into new books, embroideries and other media that build upon the story I've only just started to tell.

I need your help.

This is not something I can do without the financial and moral support of every person who believes in me and wants me to keep it going. The fundraising goal is a big one. In Central and South America, food and lodging are cheap, and gas is cheaper than it was two years ago.. but motorcycle parts in these regions are expensive, as are vehicle importation permits, inoculations, travelers' health and bike insurance. The minimum cost of transporting myself and my motorcycle once across the Darien Gap - that impenetrable break in the Pan American Highway - is $900. Then there's the return home... human/moto transport from Buenos Aires back to North America will run twice that much.

$17,500 is a drop in the bucket, then, if you let your imagination go... but the last two years have shown me how to make money stretch. My current motorcycle is small, simple, easy to repair and gas efficient. I'll be gone for a long time, which means I won't have a home to pay rent for. And I've already sold or given away most of my possessions, so there will be no monthly storage fees to worry about. (Most of my art work is in the loving hands of Gallery Aferro in New Jersey, by the way.. and it'll still be for sale while I'm gone ;) ).

If I don't reach my goal, I'll still go as far south as I possibly can, as far as down as the money I have raised will allow me. I am determined to make this work, no matter what it takes.

For your Generosity..

I have fantastic perks, already finished or being made right now... meaning the pieces you see here will be shipped before I leave, as supplies last. 

There are brand-new ISoftheF&B t-shirts, in white and heather grey, in unisex and women's sizes. And limited edition tabloid-sized posters for the Frightening and Beautiful book launch party, featuring 5 of the best bands in the Mojave Desert (where I've been holing up for the last several months). There are original art works available: watercolors based on images from the journey and hand-sewn second editions of embroideries I left in the Mexican landscape.

The most important of these is my book. This is a labor of love. It's the essence of what is, to me, "frightening" and "beautiful", filled with images that compliment and clash from the various corners of the northern hemisphere I've seen so far. It is the guts of my project - all of the experiences, simple but explosive, compacted into 4x6 inches and 112 pages. I'm also making hard bound, hand-stitched versions, a limited edition of 20 only, signed and numbered (these are special.. they take about 5 hours each to make!).

                           

And if you donate by February 21, you'll get a shout-out from the stage at the upcoming Frightening & Beautiful Fundraiser and Book Launch, featuring 5 of the very best bands in the SoCal desert at the legendary Palms Restaurant in Wonder Valley, CA.

                  

Other ways to help

Not everyone can contribute financially.. such is the reality of the world we live in. If you'd like to help but are strapped for cash, there are other ways. Since I'll be doing most, if not all of this journey solo, I'll be looking for more contacts throughout Mexico, Central and South America - folks I can turn to if I get into trouble, need a place to stay, or a dirty floor upon which to change my oil. I'm always grateful for route and site suggestions as well, from those of you in the know.

Please feel free to share the hell out of this thing on Facebook or Twitter! The more people who know I'm out there, the better. Moral support and the strength I draw from friends is critical.. without it I'll stop dead in my tracks.

Conceived through the act of riding a motorcycle, In Search of the Frightening & Beautiful embraces risk and vulnerability to record and testify to the “frightening and beautiful” - to the coincidences, contradictions and struggles that reveal the essence of human experience. 

With a little bit of luck and a lot of help from folks like you, it will eventually make its way around the world.

Thank you.

Heather L. Johnson

http://heatherLjohnson.com
story_txt:
In Search of the Frightening & Beautiful: To the Bottom of the World 


My name is Heather Johnson. I've been a working visual artist for close to 25 years, inspired by the landscape and the feeling I get when I travel through it.
It's been nearly two years since I first launched In Search of the Frightening and Beautiful, my ongoing motorcycle journey and visual art project. It all started in 2012 with an invitation to the BoxoHOUSE artist residency program in Joshua Tree, CA. The invitation became a departure point for something massive. Since then, I have ridden alone over 25,000 miles and have left 30 small gifts everywhere in the form of hand-embroidered art works, dropped in the landscapes of the United States and Mexico, for random folks to encounter and keep. 
I have had experiences too profound to describe. I've ridden through monsoons. Met total strangers who've saved my life. Crashed several times on muddy, rocky, rutted dirt roads. And made many new friends, whose words and actions will stay with me for the rest of my life. (Read about much of this on the project blog, here.)
IN SEARCH OF THE FRIGHTENING & BEAUTIFUL is motivated by a need for connection and understanding in a world governed too frequently by fear, ignorance and mistrust. It crosses geographic and cultural boundaries,  leaving bits of humanity in its wake in the form of intimate, painstakingly-made gestures let loose in the landscape, set adrift in the world to change hands, context and meaning.
                                    

                                    
Since March 2013, I have made 25 new works of art based on experiences from my journey, which have been shown in four exhibitions in New York, Mexico and California. (For more information about my work and art practice, see  http://heatherLjohnson.com.)


I've given lectures at two universities, conducting a workshop for students at one of them. I've just completed the first frightening and beautiful book, hot off the press and ready to ship. Articles have been written, the Facebook page is active and the project's audience is growing, confirming the need to keep it alive. You could say I have unfinished business to take care of.
NEXT MONTH I WILL HEAD SOUTH AGAIN, this time much farther, as far as resources will allow, toward the bottom of the southern hemisphere. I will venture back down through Mexico, into Guatemala, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, Panama and with a little luck, across the Darien Gap into Colombia and beyond. I'll leave in my wake a trail of new pieces, embroidered with motorcycle body parts and bits of text describing observations I've collected so far on the journey... small bits of humanity intended to coincide with the lives of total strangers, whose cultures and languages different from my own. When I return, I'll continue to grow what I've started, incorporating what I've learned into new books, embroideries and other media that build upon the story I've only just started to tell.


I need your help.   This is not something I can do without the financial and moral support of every person who believes in me and wants me to keep it going. The fundraising goal is a big one. In Central and South America, food and lodging are cheap, and gas is cheaper than it was two years ago.. but motorcycle parts in these regions are expensive, as are vehicle importation permits, inoculations, travelers' health and bike insurance. The minimum cost of transporting myself and my motorcycle once across the Darien Gap - that impenetrable break in the Pan American Highway - is $900. Then there's the return home... human/moto transport from Buenos Aires back to North America will run twice that much.
$17,500 is a drop in the bucket, then, if you let your imagination go... but the last two years have shown me how to make money stretch. My current motorcycle is small, simple, easy to repair and gas efficient. I'll be gone for a long time, which means I won't have a home to pay rent for. And I've already sold or given away most of my possessions, so there will be no monthly storage fees to worry about. (Most of my art work is in the loving hands of Gallery Aferro in New Jersey, by the way.. and it'll still be for sale while I'm gone ;) ).
If I don't reach my goal, I'll still go as far south as I possibly can, as far as down as the money I have raised will allow me. I am determined to make this work, no matter what it takes.
For your Generosity..
 I have fantastic perks, already finished or being made right now... meaning the pieces you see here will be shipped before I leave, as supplies last. 
There are brand-new ISoftheF&B t-shirts, in white and heather grey, in unisex and women's sizes. And limited edition tabloid-sized posters for the Frightening and Beautiful book launch party, featuring 5 of the best bands in the Mojave Desert (where I've been holing up for the last several months). There are original art works available: watercolors based on images from the journey and hand-sewn second editions of embroideries I left in the Mexican landscape.
The most important of these is my book. This is a labor of love. It's the essence of what is, to me, "frightening" and "beautiful", filled with images that compliment and clash from the various corners of the northern hemisphere I've seen so far. It is the guts of my project - all of the experiences, simple but explosive, compacted into 4x6 inches and 112 pages. I'm also making hard bound, hand-stitched versions, a limited edition of 20 only, signed and numbered (these are special.. they take about 5 hours each to make!).

                           
And if you donate by February 21, you'll get a shout-out from the stage at the upcoming Frightening & Beautiful Fundraiser and Book Launch, featuring 5 of the very best bands in the SoCal desert at the legendary Palms Restaurant in Wonder Valley, CA.
                  
Other ways to help
Not everyone can contribute financially.. such is the reality of the world we live in. If you'd like to help but are strapped for cash, there are other ways. Since I'll be doing most, if not all of this journey solo, I'll be looking for more contacts throughout Mexico, Central and South America - folks I can turn to if I get into trouble, need a place to stay, or a dirty floor upon which to change my oil. I'm always grateful for route and site suggestions as well, from those of you in the know.
Please feel free to share the hell out of this thing on Facebook or Twitter! The more people who know I'm out there, the better. Moral support and the strength I draw from friends is critical.. without it I'll stop dead in my tracks.



Conceived through the act of riding a motorcycle, In Search of the Frightening & Beautiful embraces risk and vulnerability to record and testify to the “frightening and beautiful” - to the coincidences, contradictions and struggles that reveal the essence of human experience. 
With a little bit of luck and a lot of help from folks like you, it will eventually make its way around the world.
Thank you.Heather L. Johnsonhttp://heatherLjohnson.com

story:
TL;DR

Hi! I'm Watson! I'm a rescue kitty. Mom and Dad have been doing all they can to save our home and their business, but we're scared. The bankers have raised the mortgage payments to stupid amounts and are now forcing us out of our home/studio/shelter.

Mom and Dad say that there is strength in numbers and lots of small contributions can add up to make a big difference. We're small, we add up and do make a big difference, so I guess they are right.

They have helped us so much and we want to help them now, so we put together this campaign to raise the funds necessary to help us get a new Furever home and them a new studio to continue making beauty and saving lives.

Your support will mean so much to my brothers and sisters, and to those I have yet to meet and play with. You'll get beautiful artwork in return, hand made by our Mom and Dad.

Our full story is below the PERKS, along with my brothers' and sisters' photos and examples of Mom and Dad's glass work. Be sure to visit our Gallery for more photos and videos and add your Comments, too. Please use the Share Links on this page, so that your friends may come here easily to see us and help.

Thank You ...from All of Us,
Watson

  The Beautiful

·  · ·••P•E•R•K•S••· ·  ·

US shipping is included in all of the smaller items, including the Solar System Collection ornament set. For the larger pieces, or international, please contact me so we can calculate what extra amount is needed over ground shipping.

· •  The Starlight Wall  • ·

All contributors will have their names engraved on an edge lighted glass wall panel that will be installed in our new studio. Every time we go to work, we'll gaze upon it and be reminded of the kind, compassionate and caring support and love that helped make it a reality; something we couldn't do... without you.

· •  Your Very Own KittEndorsement!  • ·

All contributors will receive a personal Thank You! note signed by one of our rescue kitties! (Perhaps more!... depending upon their cooperability on a given day.)


· •  Moon Pendant Necklace - $20  • ·

The Dark Moon pendant is a whimsical Man in the Moon. It has a fumed coating that changes color depending upon the angle of light striking its surface. It comes with a silver plated bale and synthetic leather cord.
•  I Want This Perk  •


· •  Pet ImaGem Pendant - $25  • ·

One of our ImaGem pendants customized with the photo of YOUR KITTY or DOG or ??? ! Solid fused 1/4 inch thick by 1 inch square crystal tile with your pet's photo printed on archival paper sealed permanently to the tile. Silver plated bale and 20 inch chain included. Keep your friend close and wear their keepsake right above your heart, so you can feel their love throughout your day.

•  I Want This Perk  •

· •  Rose - $35  • ·

A Blown Glass Rose paperweight Many colors available - red, black, blue, purple, yellow, orange, white.... just let me know your preference. This 2" beautiful little rose fits in the palm of your hand.

•  I Want This Perk  •


· •  Gallifrey - $45  • ·

A gorgeous blown glass ornament inspired by the Doctor Who planet of Gallifrey! Have the home world of the Time Lords on your Christmas tree, or hanging in your window all year long. Hopefully, along with a visit from your favorite Doctor! These are not currently available on our websites, so this may be your only chance!

•  I Want This Perk  •


· •  Cresting Wave - $50  • ·

Ahhh.. I just love these Wave Paperweights. Approximately 3 inches wide and tall, with the deep ocean colors inside and the white and clear foam on the top, they're so wonderful to make and they come out just beautiful. Mmmm... Love them!

•  I Want This Perk  •


· •  Kitty Face Bottle Stopper - $95  • ·

A whimsical blown glass bottle stopper made in your cat's colors. Send me a photo of your Friend with Fur and we'll do our best to capture his/her essence in glass. The stopper is food grade stainless steel with a stepped ribbed seal to securely fit many diameters. These are not currently available on our websites, so be one of the first!

•  I Want This Perk  •


· •  Comet Ornament - $95  • ·

•  I Want This Perk  •

A beautiful blown glass Comet ornament! Blues, whites and greys of the coma drift off from the nucleus by about 6 inches. This ornament adds a touch of science to your Christmas tree, or catches the sunshine in your window all year long. It is not available on our websites, so this might be your only chance!


· •  Blown Glass Saturn Ornament - $95  • ·

•  I Want This Perk  •

A beautiful blown glass ornament made from six colors of glass swirled to form Saturn's cloud patterns. Individual storms can be seen in the cloud tops. The transparent/translucent ring plane is 4.5 inches in diameter. Four of Saturn's major rings are reproduced to scale, following Cassini spacecraft data.


· •  Glowing Planet Ornament - $125  • ·

•  I Want This Perk  •

An amazing glow in the dark ringed planet ornament! The planet part is a gorgeous blue/green, but it also has swirls of glowing aqua. Powered by the daylight, it charges up and will eerily glow far into the night. These are just so fun. The rings are iridescent and carved, stunningly beautiful, about 4.5" diameter! These are not currently available on the website, so this may be your only chance!


· •  Glowing Dragon Egg - $125  • ·

•  I Want This Perk  •

An amazing glow in the dark Dragon Egg paperweight! The egg has interior colors and exterior egg colors, but with parts that glow. Powered by the daylight, it charges up and will glow far into the night. Turn on the included light base for added glow and effect.

The upper section, where the grey spots stop and you can see through to the orange, has multiple levels of glass, so the thin yellow, white and black tendrils float above each other. When you turn it, the depth is Magnificent!

These eggs are incredible at about 4 inches tall! These are not currently available on our websites, so this is your best opportunity! When these do go up on the website the price will be higher.


· •  Blown Glass Kitty Cruet - $150  • ·

•  I Want This Perk  •

A delightful bottle/pitcher in the shape of a cat and in YOUR Cat's colors if desired. They're approximately 6.5 inches tall and come in two designs. The alternate shape has a narrower neck and is wider at the bottom in a teardrop shape, while this one is wider at the shoulders.

They can be used as cream pitchers, oil and vinegar bottles, lotion... even Tabasco sauce or custard for your fish fingers!

These are not currently available on our websites, so this is your best opportunity! When these do go up on the website, the price will be higher.


· •  Primordial Soup - $195  • ·

•  I Want This Perk  •

Gorgeous Saturn soup bowl and ring plate. The plate is fused glass, iridescent 12 inch diameter, carved with Cassini data for the rings of Saturn, then molded with a ring pattern. Soup bowl is blown glass, about 4.5" diameter by 3" tall, made the colors of Saturn. Both are food, dishwasher and microwave safe! These are not available on our websites, so this is your best opportunity! When these do go up on the website the price will be higher.


· •  The Solar System Collection Ornament Set - $395  • ·

•  I Want This Perk  •

In time for Christmas!!! These ornaments are from our planetary series. The set includes the Sun, 8 planets and Pluto. They are made from multiple colors of glass to depict each planet's characteristics, using scientific data. Great for your tree, but can be hung in the window the rest of the year, so the sunlight makes them sparkle and glow. They're made to be heirlooms, so are nice and thick art glass.


· •  Convection - $850  • ·

•  I Want This Perk  •

The Convection Series represents the relative flows of fluidic heat. They are hand blown to achieve their sensual curved shapes, precisely balanced, cut to stand tall and polished to be brilliant. Then, using the lost art of reverse painting, they are infused with vivid and soft colors that enhance and intensify the gorgeous refraction of the crystal. Sizes range from 10 to 18 inches. While colors may vary slightly, due to the nature of reverse painting they are always intense and beautiful. Available in six colors: Orange & Warm Yellow, Blue & Cool White, Indigo & Raspberry, Forest Green & Cool Yellow, Blue & Aquamarine, Purple & Blue-White.


· •  Custom Watercolor Painting - $1,000  • ·

A custom watercolor/acrylic original painting, created with your input. 18"x28" (or equivalent) image area, in a beautiful wooden frame, with archival matting. Pet portrait? Fantasy? Spacey? Give me some guidelines and we'll let the imagination spin! You'll get progress images and blog posts about your piece, plus input and approval. More examples can be seen at: http://glassnebula.com/traditional.html

•  I Want This Perk  •

· •  ORIGINAL Reverse Glass Painting - $1,950  • ·


An original reverse glass painting, titled First Kiss. It's a stunningly beautiful painting, with iridescent pigments in the snow drifts so they sparkle like Mother of Pearl. Painting size is 24" x 12", framed and ready to hang. Priced well below the website price, exclusively for this campaign.

•  This Perk Found A Home  •


· •  6 Foot Diameter Solar System Mobile - $3,000  • ·

•  I Want This Perk  •

The mobile is similar to the one above (that one is 24 feet), but made with  the Sun, 8 planets and Pluto from our Solar System Collection. Each orb is made with multiple colors of glass to depict the particular planet's characteristics, using scientific data. Then, we mold carbon fiber feathers for each planet to rotate around the Sun! Awesome!!!


· •  Humongous Solar System Mobile - $74,000 • ·

•  I Want This Perk  •

The Sun is 18 inches (46cm) in diameter, Saturn's rings are 23 inches (58cm). The completed structure measures 18 feet (5.5m) from Sun to Pluto/Charon. The complete stack is taller than a person and yet weighs only 49 lbs. (22kg).

It is made of blown glass, carbon fiber, polycarbonate, aircraft grade hardware and aluminum, and stainless steel safety wire.

You can watch it for hours, as the orbs serenely ghost along on the gentle zephyrs surrounding them. Sometimes, they move at about the speed of the real planets. Nothing appears to be moving but when you return after a few hours, Saturn is over there. They even operate on the same principles of a solar system. Based upon balanced proportional mass, the objects move about barycenters. As they orbit, the planets perturb the Sun; just like real planets do—but on an obviously different scale.

It's all ready to go and can be installed by the end of Summer.

  The Good

"When a person loves cats, I am their friend and comrade, without further introduction."
- • Mark Twain • -

Our Effort — Our Calling:

We run a small rescue shelter for abandoned, orphaned and abused kitties. Together, we have saved 32 lives. Individually, many more. 17 are currently under our care.

They come to us, one way or another—some as singletons, some as whole families, some evidently having traveled long distances and in bad shape, some injured—asking for help. We take them in; providing them with a haven, needed medical attention, rehabilitation ... and love. They become adopted members of our family with remarkable success and live full, rich, safe and happy lives!

Our place looks like a Daycare center; toys everywhere, people napping wherever they happen to collapse.  :)  It's been rewarding and sometimes heartbreaking, but well worth every effort, every second and every penny.. After all, we don't really have a choice... do we?

Sharing From That Which We Have Been Given:


Ash Inclusion Memorial

In helping them over the years, we've also felt the calling to use our talents to help many others by creating Kitty Memorials for passed-on Furever Friends. It's the very least we could do to help ease the pain that we, ourselves, have felt so deeply.

During these blowing sessions we become so emotionally and spiritually connected when respectfully handling the remains that we have to stop for a few moments to blot the tears, so we can see. When the completed memorial emerges from the annealer the following day, what we feel inside cannot ever be put into mere words.

A Safe Outdoor Place to Run and Climb:

Be sure to view the videos and photos on our Gallery Tab; especially ones of the KittEnclosure that we built to give them a place to run and climb; safe from the large predators that live on this mountain. It's really fun to watch the kids climb The Tower to the Branch Bridge between areas. They love it and so will you!

To Support That Ongoing Effort:

· •  We Build Cool Stuff!™  • ·

Hello! I'm Joy Alyssa Day, a professional artist of 25 years. I specialize in Glass Blowing, Reverse Glass and Traditional Painting. My partner, BJ Johnson, is an artist-engineer, specializing in Concept Design, 3D Modeling, Animation, Glass Blowing and Technical Illustration. Learn more about us through the links above or in the Our Team section, just below.

Being multidisciplinary, we're into a lot of different stuff:

We've created paintings from miniatures up to a 26 Foot (8m) Canvas Mural,


The Origin Of Meteorites at Chabot Space & Science Center, Oakland, California
  • Spacecraft illustrations for NASA Headquarters, JPL, Northrop Grumman, Lockheed Martin, Scientific American, Wall Street Journal, New York Times, Forbes, Fortune, Time, Newsweek, New Yorker, Coca-Cola, Smithsonian
  • Sculptures up to a 7 Foot Tall, 345 lb. Blown Glass Award (seen below)
  • A 6 Foot Wide Programmable Orrery
  • A 40 Foot Wide Blown Glass & Carbon Fiber Mobile of the Solar System
  • The Planetary Society Cosmos Award (seen below)
  • The 2014 Hugo Award

... to name only a very few. Much of that was before 2008, when you-know-what happened... to everyone. Well, most everyone that is.

Still, our ArtWorks have been commissioned, purchased and enjoyed by patrons and clients spanning the globe, through Amazon, Artfire, and our websites. It has been an honor to see them travel so far and enrich so many lives.


Left: Apollo 13 Commander Jim Lovell receiving his
General James E. Hill Lifetime Space Achievement Award.
Right: Stephen Hawking's Blown Glass Saturn Cosmos Award.

We're In the Business of Making a Difference.

We work hard for that and we work hard for our rescues, but we have a problem that we need help with.

  The Bad
~  Forced Out of Our Home    or    Speaking of Predators...  ~

Due to a predatory loan from Bank of America, our mortgage payment has been steadily increasing until it got unaffordable; as they raised the payment to over $7,600/month! We've been working diligently since 2009 to modify it, but they have had us on a 5+ year merry-go-round of: "lost" documents, "never received" docs, incorrect forms to follow (no wonder they never received the required docs), "expired" docs, and docs received but then "invalidated" for obviously dubious reasons.

It was a shell game. They've been quietly tacking thousands and thousands of dollars onto the original principal; all the while threatening us with auctions that they would then put off for another month to keep us distracted and believing that relief was still possible if we persevered.

Once we got the Treasury Department involved, suddenly: "We have all of the required documents." and the bankers granted an MHA Loan Modification in two weeks time!

However, their "solution" isn't the relief that HAMP was intended to be. The payments on their now-inflated principal add up to more than 4.5x what the property is actually worth.

  The Ugly

· •  The Challenge At Hand  • ·

We are making their new "lower", but still exorbitant, payments but that's not an option for the long term. They are extorting us by pushing off the auction to the very next month to immediately evict if we don't pay. We have no choice, no time! Our only viable option, and the only responsible thing to do money-wise, is to move immediately!

We are moving not only the rescue shelter and household goods but, along with them, a whole business. Our genius lab holds a lot of densely sphere-packed stuff. Glass blowing is an endeavor that requires a lot of equipment, tools and materials that must be handled with care: water cooled saws and grinders, kilns, annealers, marvers, gaffer's benches, pipes, pontils, the list goes on...

Some of the equipment is large and very heavy, yet delicate; as is the glass. Dismantling everything that we've built; unwiring and extracting it, disassembling it, packing it, transporting it and setting it all up again is going to be an arduous task.

· •  A Silver Lining  • ·

While this is very stressful, the positive that we are focusing on is that it can be an opportunity to get a studio that is sustainable for the long term. We'll be paying far less with more room to create and be able to focus on the new and exciting ideas we've wanted to make; without this stress monkey on our backs.

You're Invited!

We'll be able to host classes, workshops, events and more; something we've wanted to do for a long time! And we'll be able to help more kitties find their own Furever Home and you can meet them all.

· •  Here Is Where You Can Make A Difference  • ·

We only have a little time. We HAVE to move by October, so that we're back in production for the Christmas season.

We need to raise at least $20,000 to help with moving costs, packing and transporting all of this heavy equipment and glass, plus our beloved rescues, from California up to Washington and getting us back up and creating again quickly. For the entire time that we will be down, we will have no income, so we need your help to be able to successfully bridge this gap and make it to the other side.

Help us save lives and create beautiful things for you to enjoy.

If you agree that ours is a worthwhile effort, jump back to the top of this page, select any PERK and let the bank know who you support.

· •  More Ways You Can Help  • ·

Watson says: "PLEASE SHARE ME!!"

Please use the Share Links at the top of this page and help spread the word, so that our GOGOFACTOR gets a needed boost and we get seen. Please tell your friends and family, your coworkers, your coffee shop, your snuggle kitty....

Please make an entry on the Comments Tab to offer a testimonial about us and our work. And be sure to take a look at the Gallery Tab for more videos and photos of our rescue kitties and other items we make.

· •  Risks & Challenges  • ·

We pledge that there are no risks. All of these items already exist. They're not in development; they are tangible and proven. We will make good on all that is offered. We are in this for the long haul and we want you to be with us.

This studio is who we are. It's our calling. It's our jobs. It's our life.

We will be setting it back up in our new location as quickly as possible. We need to be running for the Christmas season, so the only challenge is if we are pushed later than October and some of the items would get minor delays. All of these rewards we have made before, and can be made in our new location.

We will be in touch every step of the way, through here and with the websites for contact. If there are delays, you will be notified. The glassblowing studio will be one of the final things we shut down before the move, so hopefully we will be able to create many of the smaller works and ship them ahead of the estimated dates.

This is our life, so we will make this happen, even if that means renting studio time with another glassblower until we can get our studio all set up and running full tilt.

· •  Our Team  • ·

Joy Alyssa Day
 BJ Johnson

And our beloved kitties, all rescues: Admiral Akbar (just couldn't get him into the trap), Arya (she's so sassy), Carbon(fiber), Dobby (The House Elf), Hagrid (very huge & very furry), Larry (somehow just fits him), MiniBlinks, Mo, Clawed Rains (was invisible for a long time), Silicon, Tesla (extremely smart), Toothless (The Reluctant Dragon), Watson (best assistant, ever), Willow, Winky, and Zot (Harry Potter blaze on her flanks). More info, stories, photos and videos on our kitties at: BengalMania.org

· • Thank You From All Of Us! • ·

One of our ImaGem pendants customized with the photo of YOUR KITTY or DOG or ??? ! Solid fused 1/4 inch thick by 1 inch square crystal tile with your pet's photo printed on archival paper sealed permanently to the tile. Silver plated bale and 20 inch chain included. Keep your friend close and wear their keepsake right above your heart, so you can feel their love throughout your day.
•  I Want This Perk  •



· •  Rose - $35  • ·

A Blown Glass Rose paperweight Many colors available - red, black, blue, purple, yellow, orange, white.... just let me know your preference. This 2" beautiful little rose fits in the palm of your hand.
•  I Want This Perk  •



· •  Gallifrey - $45  • ·

A gorgeous blown glass ornament inspired by the Doctor Who planet of Gallifrey! Have the home world of the Time Lords on your Christmas tree, or hanging in your window all year long. Hopefully, along with a visit from your favorite Doctor! These are not currently available on our websites, so this may be your only chance!
•  I Want This Perk  •



· •  Cresting Wave - $50  • ·

Ahhh.. I just love these Wave Paperweights. Approximately 3 inches wide and tall, with the deep ocean colors inside and the white and clear foam on the top, they're so wonderful to make and they come out just beautiful. Mmmm... Love them!
•  I Want This Perk  •



· •  Kitty Face Bottle Stopper - $95  • ·

A whimsical blown glass bottle stopper made in your cat's colors. Send me a photo of your Friend with Fur and we'll do our best to capture his/her essence in glass. The stopper is food grade stainless steel with a stepped ribbed seal to securely fit many diameters. These are not currently available on our websites, so be one of the first!
•  I Want This Perk  •


· •  Comet Ornament - $95  • ·


•  I Want This Perk  •
A beautiful blown glass Comet ornament! Blues, whites and greys of the coma drift off from the nucleus by about 6 inches. This ornament adds a touch of science to your Christmas tree, or catches the sunshine in your window all year long. It is not available on our websites, so this might be your only chance!


· •  Blown Glass Saturn Ornament - $95  • ·


•  I Want This Perk  •
A beautiful blown glass ornament made from six colors of glass swirled to form Saturn's cloud patterns. Individual storms can be seen in the cloud tops. The transparent/translucent ring plane is 4.5 inches in diameter. Four of Saturn's major rings are reproduced to scale, following Cassini spacecraft data.


· •  Glowing Planet Ornament - $125  • ·


•  I Want This Perk  •
An amazing glow in the dark ringed planet ornament! The planet part is a gorgeous blue/green, but it also has swirls of glowing aqua. Powered by the daylight, it charges up and will eerily glow far into the night. These are just so fun. The rings are iridescent and carved, stunningly beautiful, about 4.5" diameter! These are not currently available on the website, so this may be your only chance!


· •  Glowing Dragon Egg - $125  • ·


•  I Want This Perk  •
An amazing glow in the dark Dragon Egg paperweight! The egg has interior colors and exterior egg colors, but with parts that glow. Powered by the daylight, it charges up and will glow far into the night. Turn on the included light base for added glow and effect.
The upper section, where the grey spots stop and you can see through to the orange, has multiple levels of glass, so the thin yellow, white and black tendrils float above each other. When you turn it, the depth is Magnificent!
These eggs are incredible at about 4 inches tall! These are not currently available on our websites, so this is your best opportunity! When these do go up on the website the price will be higher.


· •  Blown Glass Kitty Cruet - $150  • ·


•  I Want This Perk  •
A delightful bottle/pitcher in the shape of a cat and in YOUR Cat's colors if desired. They're approximately 6.5 inches tall and come in two designs. The alternate shape has a narrower neck and is wider at the bottom in a teardrop shape, while this one is wider at the shoulders.
They can be used as cream pitchers, oil and vinegar bottles, lotion... even Tabasco sauce or custard for your fish fingers!
These are not currently available on our websites, so this is your best opportunity! When these do go up on the website, the price will be higher.


· •  Primordial Soup - $195  • ·


•  I Want This Perk  •
Gorgeous Saturn soup bowl and ring plate. The plate is fused glass, iridescent 12 inch diameter, carved with Cassini data for the rings of Saturn, then molded with a ring pattern. Soup bowl is blown glass, about 4.5" diameter by 3" tall, made the colors of Saturn. Both are food, dishwasher and microwave safe! These are not available on our websites, so this is your best opportunity! When these do go up on the website the price will be higher.


· •  The Solar System Collection Ornament Set - $395  • ·


•  I Want This Perk  •
In time for Christmas!!! These ornaments are from our planetary series. The set includes the Sun, 8 planets and Pluto. They are made from multiple colors of glass to depict each planet's characteristics, using scientific data. Great for your tree, but can be hung in the window the rest of the year, so the sunlight makes them sparkle and glow. They're made to be heirlooms, so are nice and thick art glass.


· •  Convection - $850  • ·


•  I Want This Perk  •
The Convection Series represents the relative flows of fluidic heat. They are hand blown to achieve their sensual curved shapes, precisely balanced, cut to stand tall and polished to be brilliant. Then, using the lost art of reverse painting, they are infused with vivid and soft colors that enhance and intensify the gorgeous refraction of the crystal. Sizes range from 10 to 18 inches. While colors may vary slightly, due to the nature of reverse painting they are always intense and beautiful. Available in six colors: Orange & Warm Yellow, Blue & Cool White, Indigo & Raspberry, Forest Green & Cool Yellow, Blue & Aquamarine, Purple & Blue-White.


· •  Custom Watercolor Painting - $1,000  • ·


A custom watercolor/acrylic original painting, created with your input. 18"x28" (or equivalent) image area, in a beautiful wooden frame, with archival matting. Pet portrait? Fantasy? Spacey? Give me some guidelines and we'll let the imagination spin! You'll get progress images and blog posts about your piece, plus input and approval. More examples can be seen at: http://glassnebula.com/traditional.html
•  I Want This Perk  •


· •  ORIGINAL Reverse Glass Painting - $1,950  • ·



An original reverse glass painting, titled First Kiss. It's a stunningly beautiful painting, with iridescent pigments in the snow drifts so they sparkle like Mother of Pearl. Painting size is 24" x 12", framed and ready to hang. Priced well below the website price, exclusively for this campaign.
•  This Perk Found A Home  •


· •  6 Foot Diameter Solar System Mobile - $3,000  • ·


•  I Want This Perk  •
The mobile is similar to the one above (that one is 24 feet), but made with  the Sun, 8 planets and Pluto from our Solar System Collection. Each orb is made with multiple colors of glass to depict the particular planet's characteristics, using scientific data. Then, we mold carbon fiber feathers for each planet to rotate around the Sun! Awesome!!!


· •  Humongous Solar System Mobile - $74,000 • ·


•  I Want This Perk  •
The Sun is 18 inches (46cm) in diameter, Saturn's rings are 23 inches (58cm). The completed structure measures 18 feet (5.5m) from Sun to Pluto/Charon. The complete stack is taller than a person and yet weighs only 49 lbs. (22kg).
It is made of blown glass, carbon fiber, polycarbonate, aircraft grade hardware and aluminum, and stainless steel safety wire.
You can watch it for hours, as the orbs serenely ghost along on the gentle zephyrs surrounding them. Sometimes, they move at about the speed of the real planets. Nothing appears to be moving but when you return after a few hours, Saturn is over there. They even operate on the same principles of a solar system. Based upon balanced proportional mass, the objects move about barycenters. As they orbit, the planets perturb the Sun; just like real planets do—but on an obviously different scale.
It's all ready to go and can be installed by the end of Summer.

  The Good

"When a person loves cats, I am their friend and comrade, without further introduction."- • Mark Twain • -
Our Effort — Our Calling:

We run a small rescue shelter for abandoned, orphaned and abused kitties. Together, we have saved 32 lives. Individually, many more. 17 are currently under our care.

They come to us, one way or another—some as singletons, some as whole families, some evidently having traveled long distances and in bad shape, some injured—asking for help. We take them in; providing them with a haven, needed medical attention, rehabilitation ... and love. They become adopted members of our family with remarkable success and live full, rich, safe and happy lives!
Our place looks like a Daycare center; toys everywhere, people napping wherever they happen to collapse.  :)  It's been rewarding and sometimes heartbreaking, but well worth every effort, every second and every penny.. After all, we don't really have a choice... do we?
Sharing From That Which We Have Been Given:

Ash Inclusion Memorial
In helping them over the years, we've also felt the calling to use our talents to help many others by creating Kitty Memorials for passed-on Furever Friends. It's the very least we could do to help ease the pain that we, ourselves, have felt so deeply.
During these blowing sessions we become so emotionally and spiritually connected when respectfully handling the remains that we have to stop for a few moments to blot the tears, so we can see. When the completed memorial emerges from the annealer the following day, what we feel inside cannot ever be put into mere words.
A Safe Outdoor Place to Run and Climb:

Be sure to view the videos and photos on our Gallery Tab; especially ones of the KittEnclosure that we built to give them a place to run and climb; safe from the large predators that live on this mountain. It's really fun to watch the kids climb The Tower to the Branch Bridge between areas. They love it and so will you!
To Support That Ongoing Effort:

· •  We Build Cool Stuff!™  • ·


Hello! I'm Joy Alyssa Day, a professional artist of 25 years. I specialize in Glass Blowing, Reverse Glass and Traditional Painting. My partner, BJ Johnson, is an artist-engineer, specializing in Concept Design, 3D Modeling, Animation, Glass Blowing and Technical Illustration. Learn more about us through the links above or in the Our Team section, just below.
Being multidisciplinary, we're into a lot of different stuff:
We've created paintings from miniatures up to a 26 Foot (8m) Canvas Mural,


The Origin Of Meteorites at Chabot Space & Science Center, Oakland, California

Spacecraft illustrations for NASA Headquarters, JPL, Northrop Grumman, Lockheed Martin, Scientific American, Wall Street Journal, New York Times, Forbes, Fortune, Time, Newsweek, New Yorker, Coca-Cola, Smithsonian
Sculptures up to a 7 Foot Tall, 345 lb. Blown Glass Award (seen below)

A 6 Foot Wide Programmable Orrery

A 40 Foot Wide Blown Glass & Carbon Fiber Mobile of the Solar System

The Planetary Society Cosmos Award (seen below)

The 2014 Hugo Award


... to name only a very few. Much of that was before 2008, when you-know-what happened... to everyone. Well, most everyone that is.
Still, our ArtWorks have been commissioned, purchased and enjoyed by patrons and clients spanning the globe, through Amazon, Artfire, and our websites. It has been an honor to see them travel so far and enrich so many lives.


Left: Apollo 13 Commander Jim Lovell receiving hisGeneral James E. Hill Lifetime Space Achievement Award.Right: Stephen Hawking's Blown Glass Saturn Cosmos Award.

We're In the Business of Making a Difference.
We work hard for that and we work hard for our rescues, but we have a problem that we need help with.

  The Bad

~  Forced Out of Our Home    or    Speaking of Predators...  ~
Due to a predatory loan from Bank of America, our mortgage payment has been steadily increasing until it got unaffordable; as they raised the payment to over $7,600/month! We've been working diligently since 2009 to modify it, but they have had us on a 5+ year merry-go-round of: "lost" documents, "never received" docs, incorrect forms to follow (no wonder they never received the required docs), "expired" docs, and docs received but then "invalidated" for obviously dubious reasons.
It was a shell game. They've been quietly tacking thousands and thousands of dollars onto the original principal; all the while threatening us with auctions that they would then put off for another month to keep us distracted and believing that relief was still possible if we persevered.
Once we got the Treasury Department involved, suddenly: "We have all of the required documents." and the bankers granted an MHA Loan Modification in two weeks time!
However, their "solution" isn't the relief that HAMP was intended to be. The payments on their now-inflated principal add up to more than 4.5x what the property is actually worth.

  The Ugly


· •  The Challenge At Hand  • ·


We are making their new "lower", but still exorbitant, payments but that's not an option for the long term. They are extorting us by pushing off the auction to the very next month to immediately evict if we don't pay. We have no choice, no time! Our only viable option, and the only responsible thing to do money-wise, is to move immediately!
We are moving not only the rescue shelter and household goods but, along with them, a whole business. Our genius lab holds a lot of densely sphere-packed stuff. Glass blowing is an endeavor that requires a lot of equipment, tools and materials that must be handled with care: water cooled saws and grinders, kilns, annealers, marvers, gaffer's benches, pipes, pontils, the list goes on...
Some of the equipment is large and very heavy, yet delicate; as is the glass. Dismantling everything that we've built; unwiring and extracting it, disassembling it, packing it, transporting it and setting it all up again is going to be an arduous task.

· •  A Silver Lining  • ·


While this is very stressful, the positive that we are focusing on is that it can be an opportunity to get a studio that is sustainable for the long term. We'll be paying far less with more room to create and be able to focus on the new and exciting ideas we've wanted to make; without this stress monkey on our backs.
You're Invited!
We'll be able to host classes, workshops, events and more; something we've wanted to do for a long time! And we'll be able to help more kitties find their own Furever Home and you can meet them all.


· •  Here Is Where You Can Make A Difference  • ·

We only have a little time. We HAVE to move by October, so that we're back in production for the Christmas season.
We need to raise at least $20,000 to help with moving costs, packing and transporting all of this heavy equipment and glass, plus our beloved rescues, from California up to Washington and getting us back up and creating again quickly. For the entire time that we will be down, we will have no income, so we need your help to be able to successfully bridge this gap and make it to the other side.
Help us save lives and create beautiful things for you to enjoy.
If you agree that ours is a worthwhile effort, jump back to the top of this page, select any PERK and let the bank know who you support.

· •  More Ways You Can Help  • ·

Watson says: "PLEASE SHARE ME!!"

Please use the Share Links at the top of this page and help spread the word, so that our GOGOFACTOR gets a needed boost and we get seen. Please tell your friends and family, your coworkers, your coffee shop, your snuggle kitty....
Please make an entry on the Comments Tab to offer a testimonial about us and our work. And be sure to take a look at the Gallery Tab for more videos and photos of our rescue kitties and other items we make.


· •  Risks & Challenges  • ·

We pledge that there are no risks. All of these items already exist. They're not in development; they are tangible and proven. We will make good on all that is offered. We are in this for the long haul and we want you to be with us.
This studio is who we are. It's our calling. It's our jobs. It's our life.
We will be setting it back up in our new location as quickly as possible. We need to be running for the Christmas season, so the only challenge is if we are pushed later than October and some of the items would get minor delays. All of these rewards we have made before, and can be made in our new location.
We will be in touch every step of the way, through here and with the websites for contact. If there are delays, you will be notified. The glassblowing studio will be one of the final things we shut down before the move, so hopefully we will be able to create many of the smaller works and ship them ahead of the estimated dates.
This is our life, so we will make this happen, even if that means renting studio time with another glassblower until we can get our studio all set up and running full tilt.


· •  Our Team  • ·

Joy Alyssa Day
BJ Johnson



And our beloved kitties, all rescues: Admiral Akbar (just couldn't get him into the trap), Arya (she's so sassy), Carbon(fiber), Dobby (The House Elf), Hagrid (very huge & very furry), Larry (somehow just fits him), MiniBlinks, Mo, Clawed Rains (was invisible for a long time), Silicon, Tesla (extremely smart), Toothless (The Reluctant Dragon), Watson (best assistant, ever), Willow, Winky, and Zot (Harry Potter blaze on her flanks). More info, stories, photos and videos on our kitties at: BengalMania.org


· • Thank You From All Of Us! • ·

story:
After 6 successful Indiegogo campaigns, "Michael Kontraros Collectibles" is proud to present its new release, "Beauty and the Beast" 80/54 mm

Your contribution is very important in order for the whole idea to be utilized and for the figure to be molded, copied, packaged and released.

All of you that will order from this site will be given FREE SHIPPING.

This is my way of thanking all of you for supporting me in this effort.

Shipping will start Wednesday 14th of October and  it will be FREE , regardless of where you are in the world!


Beauty and the Beast

The unpainted kit contains 5 miniatures

The Beast (size: 80mm)

The Beauty (size: 54mm)

3x fairies (15mm/each)

Includes a High quality scenery!


12 pieces of High Quality Resin Casting in a metal box

Box Art: Kiriakos Simos

story:
Short Summary


I want to set up a small studio for my mother where she can create gifts. She is very skillful and talented and she's got art thinking. She can create unique things from different materials: small souvenirs, gifts made of various textile products, glass ornaments, icons and small pictures, earrings, bracelets, candles, etc. She has a flair for packaging and generally knows how to please people with small gestures.


Unfortunately, now she has no chance to work this, and has to work in large industrial factory to earn for a living. And I just want her to be happy.
For several years I have been trying to raise money to realize this art gift shop for her. She lives in Bulgaria and the studio will be there, too. 
I developed the idea and I did some calculations and business plan for what will be needed for a small studio and web gallery to represent handmade products.



What We Need & What You Get

- Studio 30 square meters - rent for 6 months - $ 4 200

- Administrative costs of start-up - $ 750
- Equipment and repair - $ 820
- Materials and tools - $ 3 800
- Building a website / web gallery of products - $ 1 400
- Advertising material, business cards, flyers, adwords campaign - $ 700
Total: $ 11 670
The last two years I have collected some of the amount that I need, but I definitely need help. The remaining amount is $ 9 450. My goal is to collect the amount by the end of September.

All who wants to help me collect the amount are welcome. Please see how I am ready to thank for the support.

 


 

Please, let's make this dream real!

story:
Short Summary

~artspace191 is bringing happiness to Vienna, with its exhibition of ArtProject Happiness.

Petronilla Hohenwarter started Artproject Happiness in 2004, and Nigel Stonham, MBA started happiness coaching in 2006. We met in 2009 and joined forces. Together we showed ArtProject Happiness in Chicago, Munich and Vienna and shared moments of happiness with many visitors. We created Vienna Happiness Project in 2011 with an artshow on 37 digital displays around Vienna for 4 weeks. In 2012 to pursue ourr passions of "raising awareness and spreading happiness" we created ~artspace191 in Vienna as a base to run inspirational art and cultural events, and as a home for ArtProject Happiness. 

Your contribution will support the show, and makes you an active part of it ~ http://artprojecthappiness.wordpress.com/video/ 


What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down for you folks in more detail:

$2000 will support the vision and the show. The money goes directly on exhibition costs ( space, travel and marketing ), and production of the artproject happiness book. You can become an integral part of the show as an ARTangel ~ the funding programme we created it to help cover our costs  of travelling with ArtProjectHappiness to spread happiness.

You get to choose from unique perks, artwork, and time with Petronilla, the artist, or Nigel, the happiness coach.  

As an ARTangel you get an original artwork, a "moment of happiness", and you join a global network of ARTangels. See available artwork here http://artprojecthappiness.wordpress.com/available-moments-of-happiness/. Select your piece from the list and email Petronilla NOW to reserve it. You will also get featured in the new book due 2013. See the current one here:-    http://artprojecthappiness.wordpress.com/artbook/

 

The Impact

Spreading happiness is great! You feel good. You become energised and able to spread more.  

The more funding we can get, the more shows we can run, the more people we can get smiling. Beyond this show in Vienna, we want to travel again to other locations with Art Project Happiness...

read what Sergio Gomez, Director of 33Contemporary in Chicago wrote:- http://artprojecthappiness.wordpress.com/artproject-happiness/curator/

and Chris Fries, curator, too:- http://artprojecthappiness.wordpress.com/artproject-happiness/curator-ch-fries/

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand perhaps you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help us to spread happiness. Spread the word, and pass on a smile. Help us to get the word out and make some noise about ArtProject HAPPINESS. Or just come along and see the works.  www.artspace191.com

story:
Help Co-Create Fractal Nation 2012!

There so many different ingredients that create this transformational alchemy, and by far the most important element is YOU. The Fractal needs you, and it needs you now. To create enough momentum for this fractal to rise up we need everyone's help.

Fractal Nation is at a pivotal turning point now that will determine the fate of this community coming out to the Playa in 2012.  If you are riding the fence and considering camping on the fringe and just coming for the party there may not be a party to come too without your support.  Please keep in mind that this is a self financed transformation, we have no financial sponsors, angels investors or bawlers to bail us out, the responsibility rests firmly on our own shoulders. This is entirely a roots initiative, and takes each and every one, every cent & contribution to pull this production together. I have seen the power, witnessed the beauty and shared the glory when we come all together and I want to see us achieve that again.  

What We Need

$7500 to help us finance bringing the Envision SoundStage to Fractal Nation 2012. These funds will be used to rent and power one of the best soundsystems available on the west coast. The SoundStage will be feature Carey Thompson' signature bamboo facade and perhaps our best line up of music and performance to date. We cannot do this without your help!

Prizes Include

  • Free: Mad Love from the Fractal Nation family and the satisfaction of knowing that you personally helped co-create Fractal Nation as your gift to the playa!
  • Single Print Fractal Nation 2012 Poster, co-designed by Android Jones and Jesse Noemind. Only available here!
  • Single Print Fractal Nation 2012 T-shirt, co-designed by Android Jones and Jesse Noemind. Only available here!
  • 2 Day Pass to Sonic Blossom, Oct 12-13th at Cervantes in Denver, Colorado. See the initial line-up here: https://www.facebook.com/events/498402683506710/
  • The change to Camp at Fractal Nation Village in 2012!!! This is your chance to join our community and co-create the experience of Fractal Nation from the inside.
  • Champagne Bubble Yum Brunch! A delectable champagne brunch aboard the Lady Sassafras art car on Playa Friday, greeting the day with sweet treats & tasty eats as we sail the open Playa in sparkley style! Angels of Audio Yum, Kayla Scintilla & MikHAL will be blessing up our boogie boat beats as we pop open the bubbles with our bosom buddayz!  Shay Butta & the AoY are excited to offer some morning  meditative movement & playful  performance as we set our intentions to celebrate our bliss in gratitude & goodness! DivinITea Maestra Kel Tea Ka will serve up some hydrating blessed teas to warm our hearts, mind & spirit. Inspired by the mojo of New Orleans & the Lady Sassafras, the attire is SPARKTACULAR!!! Rally your sparkley bits & bobs as you shine the bubbly beauty that you are, reflecting the  light of your Yum! Sparkle poneys & disco ducks.... You know the Steez! Chamonnaa!!! (who's got the Michael Jackson sparkle socks?!?!!)
  • 4-Day Pass to Sonic Bloom, Summer 2013 in Colorado. www.sonicbloomfestival.com
  • 5-Day Pass to Envision Festival in Costa Rica. Feb 27th-Mar 3rd, 2013. www.EnvisionFestival.com
  • A signed giclee (fine art digital print) from the Tribe 13 Art Gallery. http://tribe13.com

A Message from Android Jones

My name is Android Jones, founding instigator of FNV.  Fractal Nation started as a small idea and has evolved into a greater vision beyond my imagination.  In 2011, working together as a family and team, we created an unprecedented experience that enriched the lives and destiny of thousands of people, and together we formed a new nexus of community.  This year will be my 10th burn, and last year at Fractal was one of the deepest and most meaningful experiences I have ever had on the Playa. 

It is our dream again to unite all of our separate busy lives, paths, skills, love, and energy to reform the fractal and create a beacon of creativity and positive energy whose ripple will all exceed and magnify our individual efforts.

Together we are all exponentially stronger than the sum of our parts, each member of Fractal Nation adds to the spiral.  Many of us have all shared different experiences at burning man and they have shaped us into the people we are today. Participating in Fractal Nation is an invitation and opportunity to transcend our roles as individual artists, and become the stewards of a higher experience to thousands of people.This year there will be more virgin burners than ever before and this is an opportunity to show so many of these new mind blown individuals the power of what happens when a community comes together for a common goal.

There so many different ingredients that create this transformational alchemy, and by far the most important element is YOU. The Fractal needs you, and it needs you now, potential without commitment is meaningless, and to create enough momentum for this fractal to rise up we need everyone's help.
         
Fractal Nation is at a pivotal turning point now that will determine the fate of this community coming out to the Playa in 2012.  If you are riding the fence and considering camping on the fringe and just coming for the party there may not be a party to come too without your support.  Please keep in mind that this is a self financed transformation, we have no financial sponsors, angels investors or bawlers to bail us out, the responsibility rests firmly on our own shoulders ,  This is entirely a roots initiative, and takes each and every one, every cent & contribution to pull this production together. I have seen the power, witnessed the beauty and shared the glory when we come all together and I want to see us achieve that again.  

So I, Android Jones, am personally asking help create Fractal Nation, an alchemical machine of human transformation that all of us collectively dreamed of the 2012 burn.  Now is the time and place for our family to come together again and grow stronger and make our impact that counts. Please share this invitation below with your friends, family, networks and whoever you feel called to join us. We can only do this together & now is your moment to decide if you want to share your Burning Man in the light of the Fractal, or stand in the memory of its shadow.

balls deep!

Android Jones-

With funds raised so far, Fractal Nation is bringing to playa:

- The Tribe13 Visionary Art Gallery

- Art installations from Carey Thompson, Luke Brown, Amanda Sage, Jason Tucker, Gaye Lub, and Matt Elson

- Camp design by past and present Bamboo DNA builders

- The Fractal Nation Speaker and Workshop Series featuring Alex and Allyson Grey, Andrew Jones, Paul Stamets, James Oroc, Rick Doblin, Ram Dass (special video feed recorded for FractalNation / Burning Man 2012), Charles Shaw, Mitch Schultz, and many more!
 
- The Crown Collective’s “Lady Sassafras” Riverboat art car

Other Ways You Can Help

Come and join us at Fractal Nation 2012. We are opening registration for participants wanting to co-create this amazing vision with us! 

Find details here: http://fractal-nation.com/welcome/

Fractal Nation is at a pivotal turning point now that will determine the fate of this community coming out to the Playa in 2012.  If you are riding the fence and considering camping on the fringe and just coming for the party there may not be a party to come too without your support.  Please keep in mind that this is a self financed transformation, we have no financial sponsors, angels investors or bawlers to bail us out, the responsibility rests firmly on our own shoulders. This is entirely a roots initiative, and takes each and every one, every cent & contribution to pull this production together. I have seen the power, witnessed the beauty and shared the glory when we come all together and I want to see us achieve that again.  


What We Need
$7500 to help us finance bringing the Envision SoundStage to Fractal Nation 2012. These funds will be used to rent and power one of the best soundsystems available on the west coast. The SoundStage will be feature Carey Thompson' signature bamboo facade and perhaps our best line up of music and performance to date. We cannot do this without your help!
Prizes Include


Free: Mad Love from the Fractal Nation family and the satisfaction of knowing that you personally helped co-create Fractal Nation as your gift to the playa!
Single Print Fractal Nation 2012 Poster, co-designed by Android Jones and Jesse Noemind. Only available here!
Single Print Fractal Nation 2012 T-shirt, co-designed by Android Jones and Jesse Noemind. Only available here!
2 Day Pass to Sonic Blossom, Oct 12-13th at Cervantes in Denver, Colorado. See the initial line-up here: https://www.facebook.com/events/498402683506710/

The change to Camp at Fractal Nation Village in 2012!!! This is your chance to join our community and co-create the experience of Fractal Nation from the inside.

Champagne Bubble Yum Brunch! A delectable champagne brunch aboard the Lady Sassafras art car on Playa Friday, greeting the day with sweet treats & tasty eats as we sail the open Playa in sparkley style! Angels of Audio Yum, Kayla Scintilla & MikHAL will be blessing up our boogie boat beats as we pop open the bubbles with our bosom buddayz!  Shay Butta & the AoY are excited to offer some morning  meditative movement & playful  performance as we set our intentions to celebrate our bliss in gratitude & goodness! DivinITea Maestra Kel Tea Ka will serve up some hydrating blessed teas to warm our hearts, mind & spirit. Inspired by the mojo of New Orleans & the Lady Sassafras, the attire is SPARKTACULAR!!! Rally your sparkley bits & bobs as you shine the bubbly beauty that you are, reflecting the  light of your Yum! Sparkle poneys & disco ducks.... You know the Steez! Chamonnaa!!! (who's got the Michael Jackson sparkle socks?!?!!)
4-Day Pass to Sonic Bloom, Summer 2013 in Colorado. www.sonicbloomfestival.com

5-Day Pass to Envision Festival in Costa Rica. Feb 27th-Mar 3rd, 2013. www.EnvisionFestival.com

A signed giclee (fine art digital print) from the Tribe 13 Art Gallery. http://tribe13.com

story:
My Story

I am a Seattle painter, calligrapher and writer. I create paintings with my own calligraphy. I also teach calligraphy classes and have been disappointed to hear that many area schools are no longer teaching cursive writing - and some have had to cut their art curriculum. I'd like to be able to donate money to Seattle Public Schools to help increase their arts programs, as I know it's the first thing being cut which to me is the soul of childhood - being able to create and make art was one of the best parts of my childhood.

I heard about IndieGoGo as a way to raise money, while listening to a segment on Good Morning America. One of the ideas I had was to donate a portion of sales of my posters to schools, but in order to do this I need some funding to get posters printed and apparently IndiGoGo is exactly the sort of program to help spread the word and raise funds to make my dream come true.

My current series deals with SOUL. Everything that is inside us that wants and needs to get out. Starting with Alphabet for the Soul I want to print this series of posters. I'm calling it The Souls Project and will donate 20% of my poster sales to The Seattle Public School system. I already have several other paintings ready in my series - one with alphabet letters, one with a colorful design with numbers and yes a wonderful painting I have about quotes I've collected about teaching. I am a prolific painter - only being held back by limited funds for art supplies and printing costs. Nothing new and different to anyone who is an artist. I started by business back in 1996 as One Heart Studio - because I was doing my heart's desire, but also it's a reflection of us all as being part of one world.


The Impact

I don't know what the impact will be. I've always wanted to help support my local schools and give back to the community, but having a limited income as an artist has always made it incredibly hard. When you start talking about soul - it is everyone's soul that I hope will be affected by this project - it's the words on the paintings I have created, it's the colors of the paint, it's the heart and soul that I put into every piece I create. But it's also the little souls that will get to blossom and grow through art programs in their schools. I just can't even imagine all the possibilities this project will create for future generations.


What I Need & What You Get

I will use the funds collected on IndieGoGo for printing services and I will sell the posters online as well as in retail galleries throughout the United States. 20% of the proceeds from sales of these posters will go back into the Seattle Schools. I will start with one small poster for $200 will get me started. If I do not receive enough to print a single poster, I will contribute my own money to start the project. A simple starting point, but the more money I get receive more images I can print and sell. I am already a published artist with many images already being licensed, but I want this to be my personal project that helps my own block, my own neighborhood, my own city. That's where I want it to start.


$   500 raised  = @3,000 printed posters (11" x 17") sold at $10 retail* each = $6000 donated to Seattle Public Schools.

If I raise more than that I will make larger posters 18"x 24"

$1,000 raised = @4,000 printed posters (18" x 24") retail* for $20 = $16,000

$2,000 raised = @ 10,000 printed posters (18" x 24") retail$ for $20 = $40,000

any posters sold at wholesale rate to galleries/shops/stores will sell for 50% of retail, but 20% of that amount will still be donated to Seattle Public Schools by me.


Other Ways You Can Help

I'm not a fan of facebook, but I know it helps spread the word and makes it a simple way that people can spread the word and let others know about important and interesting things that are happening whether they are just here in Seattle or around the world. Still thinking about Egypt and how millions of people made a peaceful demonstration change a regime and how it really just started with a facebook page. So please spread the word and once the presses start rolling I'll update my blog with status as well. So I am hoping that you can help. Knowing that even $10 donation will help in the long run. Just donating money is not where I hope it ends. Spread the word about the posters and where the proceeds are going, because the only way I can reach my donation goals is to sell the posters an each poster will be even better than the first one. Collector's items and wonderful images for you, your family and your friends.

story:
The 3D Valentine!

For just 10 bucks we are offering our original art printed on a 5" x 7" card and your very own pair of 3D glasses packaged in a red envelope and delivered no later than February 12th within the US, shipping included.  Now you can express your affection for your Sweetie in 3D on VD!  Plus we'll be contributing 10% of profits to support Oregon United For Marriage, promoting marriage equality for all.

After a spontaneous afternoon focused on distracting each other from our respective projects by passing anaglyph imagery back and forth across our cut table, we were inspired to collaborate on a piece of original art for a 3D Valentine.  We couldn't find 3D glasses available for sale locally, so we ran out to our local art store and bought 2 sheets of acetate, one blue and one red.  Back at the shop we made ourselves some super-dope custom 3D glasses and set about researching how to create an anaglyph image. Soon we were jammimg on the artwork and exploring how to manipulate it for the best 3D affect.

The 3D Valentine is brought to you by Josh Anderson, Peter Williams, and Ruby Michelle Fuller.  We share studio space at The Makery in Portland, Oregon.  Josh is a freelance illustrator, a sports buff, and an avid coffee drinker.  Peter is a freelance product designer, craftsman, and general enthusiast.  Ruby is the best dog on Earth.  Sorry other dogs.  It's one man's opinion.

We hope you've enjoyed our video and like the card!

Thanks for your support.

What will the money cover?

Your $10.00 purchase covers the cost of printing the card, a pair of 3D glasses, an envelope, packaging and shipping for a February 12th delivery (within the US,) as well as our studio time working on the project.  We will also be donating 10% of proceeds from the 3D Valentine sale to Oregon United For Marriage, a non-profit organization promoting marriage equality for all.  Find out more about the great work they do here: http://www.oregonunitedformarriage.org/

Don't forget the value of giving your sweet thing a fun, limited edition card created by independent artists in the US!

What this means to us.

We've had such a good time on this project that we have committed to making a collaborative piece of art for each month of 2014.  Our hope is that this year long endeavor will mature into a reliable piece of the income puzzle that we are challenged to put together; as are independent artists, designers, and craftspeople all over the world.

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign and for considering supporting it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in the market for a 3D Valentine and want to support our project you can contribute by spreading the word within your community.  Please email a link to our campaign to anyone that you think might be interested, reach out on Facebook, post it on Instagram, Tweet a link, or just get out there and holler about it on the street corner. (While the latter may be the least effective, it's the most exciting option to us!...)

Thanks again!

Peter & Josh

Harkaway

JL Anderson Illustration

story:
A little about MWABA:

We are a 501(c)(6) non-profit association of book dealers and we have been holding rare book fairs here in Chicago since the 1970s. 

As with brick & mortar bookstores & other regional book fairs, our fairs had been in a decline until last year when we found a new home at the Plumbers Hall and developed a smarter marketing strategy.

At last year's book fair we tripled the previous year's attendance and realized we had something very special that book lovers really enjoyed --we just needed to get the word out to the right audience. 

We have the resources & experience to hold the book fair in October, but what we need is more advertising funds. We are currently advertising on the radio (WBBM, WXRT, WFMT and NPR), in the Chicago Tribune, and in many other media.

Donors to our campaign have a choice of perks: passes to the book fair, tote bags, or a choice of 10 books from Powell's Chicago- click the "Gallery" link above to see them.

There's nothing like the Chicago Book & Paper Fair here in Chicago, where you can view & purchase beautiful & historically significant books--your contributions will help sustain something very unique & worthwhile.

Hope to see you at the fair on October 11th!

Midwest Antiquarian Booksellers Association (MWABA) 
Presents the 53rd Chicago Book & Paper Fair

Saturday, October 11, 2014 
10am to 5pm


Local 130 Plumbers Union Hall
1340 W. Washington Blvd.
Chicago, IL 60607

Admission: $6.00 / $4.00 for students with ID

FREE PARKING!

story:
We are a group of middle school students in Tucson, Arizona who have been given the amazing opportunity by our teachers to engage in real world business management to fund many incredible learning opportunities. We have formed a group that is passionate about metalwork of many varieties: sculptures, jewelry, and much more. Everything being sold has been made by the middle school students in the metals group.

All funds we collect will be put towards future projects and field trips, but most of it will be put towards an immersion week at Me-to-We Windsong Ranch. This is a five day long trip to Patagonia where we will learn about protecting the environment, fostering peace, and developing strong leadership skills. With this expeirience we are learning that we have the power to make a huge impact in the community around us. Help us make a difference.

We appreciate any and all contributions, no matter how much you may decide to donate.We can only hope to inspire change through the art that we make.

Thank you,

Montessori Metal and More

 

Photos of Perks Available:

 

Copper Bookmarks

 

 

Tea Candle Holders (Show is size Medium)

 

 

Chain Link Bracelets

 

 

Paper Beaded Bracelets

 

 

Beaded Necklaces

 

 

Metal Love Necklaces

 

Beaded Earrings

 

 

Copper Hoop with Bead

 

 

Origami Dangling Earrings

 

 

Origami Stud Earrings

 

 

Peacock Feather Earrings

 

Origami Dangling Earring Options (Please comment below the # you want, if not a random one will be given.)

 

Paper Bead Dangling Earring Options (Please comment below the # you want, if not a random one will be given.)

 

 

Beaded Earring Options (Please comment below the # you want, if not a random one will be given.)
